title: Finance Manager & Controller (Bilingual FRENCH-ENGLISH)
description:
Financial Controller



Job title: Financial Controller  

Location: Remote
Terms: 3 years full-time contract
Salary/rate: $1000 - $2000 depending on the experience
Reporting to: CEO/ Finance Manager


Company Introduction‚ÄØ:

About us:

Our company has currently 3 main locations: France, UAE, Hong Kong. But overall we are a fully distributed company, and we like it like that. Our AMOOVers are spread in 9 countries at the moment and we expect this number to grow in the future. AMOOVers work from wherever they want


AMOOV Vision:

To be the most loved and used mover in the world and make 100,000+ international moves annually



AMOOV Core Values:



Below you will be introduced the 6 AMOOV values. As a whole, they represent our compass needle to our vision & mission:


As an acronym, you can think of our values as:‚ÄØ F O ‚Äúr‚Äù T I C H (slang for strong).

Focus: ‚ÄØVisualize & paint, focus & execute

Ownership & speed .‚ÄØfor actions: We do what we Say & say what we do, with speed

Team Ship: Collaborate and innovate as a team

Innovative Mindset: There is a way to do it better: find it. Thomas Edison

Customer obsession: Absolute dedication on providing the greatest experience

Hungry for growth: The more you give, the more you get


Requirements:

Minimum of 5 years of experience as a Financial Controller, FP&A Analyst, or Management Controller, preferably in the supply chain, SME, or freight forwarding industries.

Strong ability to identify and implement process improvements.

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work across departments.

Hands-on approach with a willingness to dive into the details when necessary.

Leadership experience, managing 1-2 direct reports.

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Finance, Business, or a related field (not necessarily in Accounting).

You speak English and French fluently

You are a great relationship builder, sales at heart.

You are a master at negotiating



Preferred Skills:

Industry experience in supply chain, SME, or freight forwarding.

Proficiency in financial software and tools (e.g., Excel, ERP systems).

Analytical mindset with the ability to translate data into actionable insights.



Other works requirements:

1) Stable internet connection of at least 10 Mbps.
2) A headphone with a microphone (preferably a noise-canceling one).
3) Reliable PC device (at least 8 GB RAM). Mac not accepted.
4) Power bank and internet and data package back-up (3G/4G/5G) (if your wifi is down).

AVAILABILITY and SCHEDULE: Full-time in Paris Time Zone (Central European Time).




About the role:

We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Financial Controller to oversee and optimize our financial operations. This role is ideal for a hands-on professional with strong business acumen and a proven track record in financial planning, analysis, and continuous improvement. The Financial Controller will work closely with managers, accountants, and business stakeholders to drive performance and ensure the company‚Äôs financial health.


Job Scope:



Develop, implement, and oversee the company‚Äôs financial plan, ensuring alignment with strategic objectives.
Lead budgeting, forecasting, cash management, and financial analysis to support decision-making.
Ensure strong financial controls, compliance, and internal processes to prevent revenue loss or liabilities.
Oversee all accounting operations, including AR, AP, collections, invoicing, and project accounting within Xero.
Optimize financial processes, transaction fees, and international transfers to improve efficiency.
Provide insightful management reports and KPIs to track and enhance business performance.
Collaborate with managers, accountants, and operational teams to align financial strategies with business goals.
Manage and mentor a small finance team, fostering accountability and continuous improvement.
Actively support finance operations and ensure seamless integration of new entities.





We Support Growth:

Supporting AMOOVers career growth benefits the team‚Äîand it benefits our company. The team members will always have an opportunity to grow and learn in their chosen career path and we support and encourage them realize their full potential.

For an Financial Controller, possible evolution path:

‚Ä¢ Finance Manager
‚Ä¢ Operational roles
‚Ä¢ Markets expansions opportunities

Depending on great performance, interests and abilities.

Who are we looking for?

AMOOV culture is one of multiculturalism. Any AMOOVer should speak at the very least 2 languages.

We are a global organization, that wants to make an impact in the world. We firmly believe AMOOVers have a role to play in a ‚Äúnew globalization‚Äù, by connecting people and countries. As old tensions are revived worldwide, or new tensions appear, more than ever, we believe in connecting the dots.

An AMOOVer is driven by helping others and attentive to micro-details. She or he is an empathetic team player, obsessed about going the extra-mile for people, no matter if that person is a client, a colleague or a partner.

If those values resonate, we encourage you very much to apply.

At AMOOV, we have big and audacious goals. That requires AMOOVERS to be OK with not being comfortable in their role, as it will require constant change and improvements. Such is the growth path.

A last & important point: we want people that are ambitious in life and in their work. We commit in helping all AMOOVers achieve their goals. In return, we strongly believe in meritocracy and in the mantra ‚ÄúThe more you give, the more you get‚Äù.

Slackers, go on your way.




You will be asked to answer the following questions when submitting a proposal:

Describe how your experience and aptitudes make you the right fit for this role

title: Data Analyst for Product Name Matching ‚Äì Fuzzy Matching & Data Cleansing
description:
We are looking for a data analyst or data scientist with experience in data cleansing, fuzzy matching, and text similarity analysis to compare and identify duplicate or near-duplicate products between two datasets. We have an excel file with fragrance product data on 12,000 products and we need the duplicates removed between the two sources below (CDPH & EWG)

üéØ Goal:

Compare CDPH (California Department of Public Health) dataset and EWG (Environmental Working Group) dataset
Identify and flag potential duplicate products based on product name similarity.
Provide an actionable report of matched products with a confidence score.

üìÇ Dataset Details:
The two datasets have different naming conventions and lack a unique identifier like UPC or Product ID.
CDPH dataset contains: Product Name, Brand, UPC, and Ingredient List.
EWG dataset contains: Product Name and Ingredients but no unique identifiers.
Challenge: Product names may differ (e.g., "Dove Body Wash" vs. "Dove Nourishing Body Cleanser").
üõ†Ô∏è Expected Work Process:
Data Preprocessing

Clean and standardize product names (lowercase, remove extra spaces, punctuation, common words like ‚ÄúEau de Parfum‚Äù).
Identify and remove unnecessary stopwords.
Fuzzy Matching / Similarity Analysis

Use fuzzy matching (Levenshtein Distance, Jaccard, Cosine Similarity, or other NLP techniques).
Implement TF-IDF and nearest neighbor search for optimized comparisons.
Use brand matching to enhance accuracy where available.
Flag possible duplicates with a confidence score.
Validation & Reporting

Deliver a final report (CSV, Excel, or Google Sheets) listing:
CDPH Product Name
EWG Matched Product Name
Match Confidence Score (0-100)
Include a summary of findings and any false positives observed.

üìà Expected Deliverables:
‚úÖ Cleaned & Processed Dataset with standardized product names.
‚úÖ Matched Product List with confidence scores.
‚úÖ Python script or methodology documentation to replicate the process.
‚úÖ Recommendations on improving future matching.
skills: ['SQL', 'LLM Prompt Engineering', 'datasets', 'text matching', 'Computer Vision', 'Data Cleaning', 'Python', 'Machine Learning']

title: Data Analyst / Business Strategist for Market Optimization in Construction Bidding
description:
Description:
We are looking for a highly skilled data analyst or business strategist with expertise in market analytics, predictive modeling, and competitive intelligence to help us optimize our bidding and operational efficiency in a niche segment of the construction industry.

Our business operates in a highly competitive, project-based environment where pricing, supply chain dynamics, and competitor behavior play a crucial role in profitability. We believe that a data-driven approach can give us a significant edge in the market, similar to how sports betting professionals and financial traders leverage statistical models to find inefficiencies.

What We Need:
Market Analysis & Predictive Modeling

Competitive Intelligence Dashboard

Risk Management & Cash Flow Optimization

Model cash flow cycles and retention payment impacts to optimize financial planning.

Ideal Candidate:

This is an exciting opportunity to apply high-level data analytics to a real-world industry challenge with massive potential. If you‚Äôre a numbers-driven problem solver who enjoys uncovering hidden opportunities in markets, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

Confidentiality: Due to the competitive nature of this initiative, further details will be provided after signing an NDA.

Budget: Open to discussion based on experience and project scope.

title: Airbnb Short-Term Rental Pricing Strategy in Google Sheets (Dynamic Formula + Automation)
description:
I am seeking an experienced Google Sheets developer (or data analyst with strong spreadsheet skills) to create a dynamic pricing strategy model for short-term rentals on Airbnb. The sheet aims to integrate various data inputs‚Äîoccupancy, average daily rates (ADR), and comp set percentile positions‚Äîinto a streamlined, automated Google Sheets environment.

I previously worked with another freelancer on this project, but due to timing, we were unable to finalize the solution. I now need a reliable expert who can pick up and improve upon existing google sheet files and deliver a robust, user-friendly tool that my team and I can easily maintain.

Background

Objective: Build an automated system in Google Sheets to project short-term rental pricing across weekdays, weekends, and holidays while factoring in occupancy and ‚Äúcomp set‚Äù percentile positioning. There are three more tabs that are laid out but need formulas to connect the backend data dump as well.

Existing Assets:
Multiple partially completed Google Sheets with tabular logic, occupant-based formulas, and references to comp set percentile data.
A script meant to handle CSV imports (e.g., 12 to 18 months of historical and upcoming data) but needs debugging and enhancement.
Loom videos demonstrating the initial approach, formulas, and advanced tasks (e.g., capturing the ‚Äúrelevant price percentile ADR,‚Äù pulling in occupancy data, etc.).
CSV files containing raw occupancy and revenue data for multiple listings.

What I Need Done:
Data Import & Parsing
Finalize or rebuild the script that ingests CSV data (12‚Äì18 months‚Äô worth), correctly handles duplicated months, and appends or overwrites existing data as necessary.
Ensure the import script can be triggered on-demand by a button or menu item in Google Sheets.
Dynamic Pricing Formula

Create (or refine) formulas that incorporate separate logic for weekdays vs. weekends/holidays.

Dashboard & Visualization

Develop a dedicated ‚ÄúDashboard‚Äù tab pulling from the processed data to display (90% done):

Testing & Validation

Thoroughly test the final formulas and scripts using sample CSV data for accuracy and ease of use.
Provide clear instructions or Loom videos explaining how to maintain and adjust the system.

Deliverables
One fully working Google Sheet:
Automated CSV Import Script
Clean, well-labeled pricing logic and formulas for accurate data analysis and adjustments.

Ideal Freelancer
Expert in Google Sheets (queries, array formulas, scripts in Apps Script).
Familiar with short-term rental revenue management (occupancy, ADR, comp sets, dynamic pricing concepts).
Excellent communication‚Äîwilling to provide Looms or detailed instructions on how to use the tool.
Proactive problem-solver who can suggest best practices for automation and clarity.

Timeline: Prefer a 2‚Äì3 week turnaround, with frequent check-ins or milestone deliveries to ensure alignment.

How to Apply
Relevant Experience: Share any related Google Sheets, formuals, and automation you‚Äôve completed.

Availability: When can you start, and how soon could you deliver a first draft?

We‚Äôll schedule a short introductory call after reviewing proposals to clarify the scope, walk you through the partial Sheet we have, and confirm next steps.

Thank you for your interest. I‚Äôm excited to find the right freelancer to help finalize and elevate this Airbnb short-term rental pricing strategy model!

The focus is on pinpointing specific, actionable opportunities within the global supermarket sector.

**Deliverables:**

* **List of Major Global Retailers (Exclusion List):**
    * A comprehensive list of the largest global retailers (e.g., Walmart, Tesco, Aldi), including their sub-brands and owned companies, to facilitate immediate exclusion from targeted sales efforts.
* **Targeted Supermarket List:**
    * A detailed list of supermarket chains within identified target countries, along with their respective sub-brands and related entities.
* **Geographic Opportunity Map:**
    * A clear and visually compelling map highlighting the geographic distribution of identified supermarket opportunities.
* **Investor-Focused Presentation:**
    * A concise and impactful presentation that includes:
        * The exclusion list and targeted supermarket list.
        * The geographic opportunity map.
        * Data-backed analysis demonstrating the potential for rapid customer acquisition and revenue growth.
        * Focused competitive landscape analysis within targeted supermarket regions, highlighting our product's differentiators.
        * Clear and easily understood charts and tables.
* **Data Accuracy:**
    * Strive to deliver the most accurate opportunity assessment possible, acknowledging that data availability may limit absolute precision. All data should be clearly referenced.

**Responsibilities:**

* **Urgent Opportunity Identification (Global Supermarkets):**
    * Analyze the characteristics of supermarkets to identify suitable business profiles.
    * Conduct focused online research to identify geographic regions and specific supermarket chains that match these profiles.
    * Focus on identifying regions where similar supermarket businesses are present and where the lack of in-house IT development for stock optimization would make our SaaS solution valuable.
    * Identify supermarkets that would benefit from improved on-shelf stock levels based on point of sale and delivery data.
* **Rapid Targeted Sales Opportunity Presentation Development (Remote):**
    * Create the deliverables listed above within the 3 day timescale.
* **Focused Competitive Landscape Analysis (Supermarkets):**
    * Identify key competitors within the identified supermarket opportunity regions, focusing on solutions that address stock optimization and replenishment.
    * Identify how our product differentiates itself from the competition within the identified opportunity regions, specifically in its ability to optimize on-shelf availability based on real-time data.
* **Rapid Remote Communication:**
    * Communicate research findings and recommendations effectively through online channels.
    * Deliver the finalized presentation and all deliverables in a clear and concise manner within the 3 day deadline.

**Project Terms:**

* This is a one-off, remote project with a fixed deadline of three working days from contract award.
* Fixed project fee.
skills: ['Market Research', 'Presentation Design', 'Business Presentation', 'Graphic Design', 'Microsoft PowerPoint']

title: [NiteOut] Senior Business Intelligence & Data Warehousing Analyst
description:
About NiteOut
NiteOut is a new 3D Social Network designed around night life that is redefining the way people go out. With NiteOut you can go out with your friends and meet new people casually -- just like you would in real-life -- from anywhere at any time. Enjoy the music, engage in bar games and dance the night away. Your nights out will never be the same.

We‚Äôre looking for a Senior Business Intelligence & Data Warehousing Analyst to build dashboards and data solutions that help us measure functionality, usage, engagement, and performance of our core experience. We want to leverage data to confirm our experience is working as intended, and also to understand the pain points, habits and preferences of our users to fuel what we do to optimize the current experience and to help inform what we build next. If you‚Äôre passionate about turning raw data into actionable insights and want to shape the future of nightlife, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

Our Website: https://niteout.co/

Responsibilities
- Develop dashboards & reports to track key metrics around user engagement, feature usage, and system performance.
- Design, optimize and manage data warehouses, data models & pipelines to support business intelligence and real-time analytics.

- Identify trends and insights to guide feature improvements and business decisions.
- Ensure data accuracy & reliability by implementing best practices in ETL, data governance, and monitoring.

Requirements
- 5+ years of experience in business intelligence, data analysis, or data engineering, preferably in consumer-facing apps or entertainment tech.
- Strong experience with SQL and working with relational databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL, Redshift, BigQuery, Snowflake, etc.).
- Expertise in BI tools such as Tableau and Power BI.
- Knowledge of data warehousing best practices and experience structuring large-scale analytics solutions.
- Ability to translate business needs into clear data requirements and actionable insights.
- Excellent communication skills with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Nice to Have
- Experience in consumer tech, social apps, or nightlife/entertainment industries.
- Exposure to real-time analytics & event-driven architectures.

title: Senior Data Scientist ‚Äì CPG Revenue Analysis & Trade Promotion Optimization
description:
We are seeking a highly experienced Senior Data Scientist to join our team and drive data-led decision making in the Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) space. In this role, you will lead complex analytic studies, develop and deploy advanced machine learning models, and provide strategic insights to optimize revenue analysis, trade promotion management, and trade promotion optimization. You will work closely with cross-functional teams‚Äîincluding data engineers, analysts, and business stakeholders‚Äîto integrate AI/ML solutions into our software products and elevate our data environment.

Key Responsibilities:

Analytical Leadership: Lead multifaceted analytic studies on large datasets using exploratory mathematical and statistical techniques.
Data Experimentation: Conduct experiments with various data sets to uncover novel solutions to challenging data problems.
Solution Implementation: Develop, test, and deploy data-driven models and solutions that effectively leverage AI/ML to optimize business operations.
Collaboration: Work closely with Data Engineers and Analysts to build robust data environments and integrate machine learning models into our software products.
Strategic Development: Formulate methodologies for project prioritization, scheduling, and the implementation of machine learning solutions.
Insight Communication: Clearly communicate data insights and strategic recommendations to stakeholders and clients, ensuring complex information is understandable and actionable.
Requirements:

Education: PhD or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field (PhD preferred).
Experience: 5-10 years of professional experience with a proven track record of building and deploying statistical and machine learning models at the enterprise level.
Technical Expertise: Deep knowledge of machine learning algorithms and statistical programming languages such as R and Python. Proficiency with SQL and data processing tools like Hive or Pig.
Data Proficiency: Strong skills in data engineering, visualization, and storytelling to translate complex datasets into actionable insights.
Problem Solving: Exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities, with experience decomposing complex business challenges and implementing quantitative solutions.
Cloud Technologies: Familiarity with cloud platforms such as Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud‚Äîwith a preference for Azure experience.
Communication & Collaboration: Excellent communication and project management skills, with the ability to work independently as well as within a team.
Preferred Qualifications:

Experience in the consumer goods industry or similar sectors (e.g., Health and Beauty Care, OTC Pharma, or Grocery/Big Box retail).
Background in large-scale operations (e.g., experience at companies like Google or Amazon) or with leading consultancy firms building data science solutions for CPG clients.
Proven experience in building trade lift models and/or marketing mix models.
Familiarity with price promotion and assortment optimization software.
Certification in Data Science, Machine Learning, or Artificial Intelligence is a plus.
If you are a strategic thinker passionate about leveraging data to drive business success in the CPG industry, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Please submit your resume along with examples of your previous work or case studies relevant to trade promotion and revenue analysis.

title: Seeking Financial Expert to Develop a 5-Year Budget & Growth Plan for Cybersecurity & Tech Firm
description:

We are seeking an experienced Financial Expert to develop a structured financial model, budget forecast, and investment plan for our Cybersecurity, Intelligence, and Technology company.

Our investor is already committed to funding the business, and we aim to reach $10M revenue within 5 years (on paper). We need a realistic, data-driven plan that breaks down:

Budget requirements to reach $10M revenue
Operational & scaling costs
Profitability & break-even timeline

This role is not about over-promising growth but about delivering a solid financial structure that justifies the investment and optimizes business decisions.

‚úÖ Budget & Cost Forecasting

‚úÖ Break-even & Profitability Roadmap

Total capital required for launch & expansion.

title: AI-Powered Business Intelligence and Data Analytics System
description:
Problem:
A mid-sized insurance & healthcare company is struggling with data management, reporting, and customer interaction. Their existing system:
‚Ä¢ It has scattered data sources (databases, spreadsheets, third-party APIs).
‚Ä¢ Relies on manual reporting, causing delays in business decisions.
‚Ä¢ Has a customer service team overloaded with queries that could be automated.
‚Ä¢ Lacks a centralized AI-driven data warehouse for analytics and predictions.
They now want to fully automate their data workflows, chatbot-driven interactions, and real-time business intelligence.

Project Overview:
This project aims to build a complete AI-powered ecosystem integrating:
1. Chatbot for customer support & data querying (Azure OpenAI + RAG).
2. Automated ETL pipelines (for structured/unstructured data).
3. Centralized Data Warehouse (Azure Synapse for real-time insights).
4. Power BI Dashboards (for business analytics & decision-making).

Functional Requirements:
1. AI-Powered Chatbot (Customer & Internal Use Cases)
     ‚Ä¢ Customer Queries:
           o Customers can chat with an AI chatbot to ask about policies, claims, coverage, or
                     medical reports.
           o The chatbot can pull data from a centralized warehouse using RAG (Retrieval-
                     Augmented Generation).
           o Example: ‚ÄúWhat is my insurance claim status?‚Äù ‚Üí Chatbot fetches real-time data.
     ‚Ä¢ Internal Queries for Employees & Analysts:
           o Employees can ask, "Show me the total claims processed last month", and the chatbot
                     retrieves live Power BI insights.
           o AI can generate reports & trends on demand.
     ‚Ä¢ Technical Stack:
           o Azure OpenAI (GPT-4) for NLP
           o Azure AI Search for RAG-based document retrieval
           o Azure Blob Storage for document management

2. Data Integration & ETL Pipelines (Automated Workflow)
     ‚Ä¢ Extract Data:
           o Data from multiple sources (SQL databases, APIs, CSVs, and PDFs).
     ‚Ä¢ Transform Data:
           o Clean, validate, and structure data using Python (Pandas, PySpark).
           o NLP-based extraction from unstructured medical reports & claims.
     ‚Ä¢ Load Data:
           o Store transformed data in Azure Synapse (Data Warehouse).
     ‚Ä¢ Automate Pipelines:
           o Use Azure Data Factory to schedule & orchestrate ETL workflows.
3. Data Warehouse (Centralized Storage & Query Engine)
     ‚Ä¢ Business Use Case:
              The company wants a real-time analytics platform to track:
           o Total claims processed per day/month/year
           o Customer retention trends
           o Risk analysis for fraud detection
           o Predictive analytics for customer churn
     ‚Ä¢ Technical Stack:
           o Azure Synapse Analytics (for scalable querying).
           o Data Modeling for optimized performance.
           o Role-based Access Control (RBAC) for data security.
4. Power BI Dashboards (Decision-Making Analytics)
     ‚Ä¢ Business Executives Dashboard:
           o High-level KPIs, revenue, customer trends.
           o Fraud detection & claim approval analytics.
     ‚Ä¢ Operational Dashboard for Agents:
           o Live insights on pending claims and new policies.
           o Customer interaction logs from chatbot queries.
     ‚Ä¢ Technical Stack:
           o Power BI Embedded to integrate dashboards into a web-based business portal.
ÔÅ∂               
End-to-End Workflow:
1. Chatbot collects data from users (queries, medical reports, policies).
2. Azure AI Search fetches relevant documents (RAG for chatbot).
3. ETL pipelines process data and load it into Data Warehouse.
4. Azure Synapse provides real-time queries on structured data.
5. Power BI visualizes insights for decision-makers.
ÔÅ∂
Ideal Team Requirements:
     ‚Ä¢ AI/ML Engineer: (Chatbot, RAG, OpenAI, NLP).
     ‚Ä¢ Data Engineer: (ETL, SQL, Azure Synapse, Power BI).
     ‚Ä¢ Full-Stack Developer: (API & Frontend for chatbot & dashboards).
     ‚Ä¢ DevOps Specialist: (Cloud deployment, security).
skills: ['Data Visualization', 'SQL', 'Business Intelligence', 'Data Analysis', 'Microsoft Power BI', 'Neo4j', 'Artificial Intelligence', 'Python', 'Data Science']

title: Geospatial analysis and visualization, part one of a long-term engagement
description:
This is the first part of a much bigger project that will eventually grow to include significant geospatial analysis and web scraping, data exploration, processing and analysis, creating interactive visualizations and dashboards, running advanced regression/ML algorithms, and creating AI agents. It will function somewhat as an interview, because I would like this person to stay on for the ongoing engagement.

This project will be used to help us identify real estate investment opportunities and so data accuracy is critical. We need someone who is focused on the impact and quality of the analysis more than we need speed. As such, I would like your estimate of what it costs to complete this, but would prefer to pay by the hour, to improve alignment, and encourage discussion and collaboration between us while you work.

I don‚Äôt expect one person to be able to be able to do all of these, but the more coverage one person can provide the better. Relatedly, I‚Äôm interested in people who have existing relationships with other developers/data analysts who they can work with to take on more of the project as a team, to the extent needed.

For the initial project, I want to develop a raster map of the United States with each point containing the total population within a 3-mile radius of said point.

I‚Äôm open to suggestions for how to approach this, but my initial thinking is as follows:
‚Ä¢ Pull population data from the US Census by Census Block (or open to suggestions for better sources)
‚Ä¢ Pull Census Block polygons/boundaries, which I assume are also available on the Census website
‚Ä¢ Convert population numbers to population densities.
    o The census tracks block areas with and without water areas included. Ideally, you can convert water areas to ‚Äúzero population‚Äù in the raster, and show the remaining points as the population density excluding bodies of water.
    o I‚Äôm very much open to suggestions for better ways to estimate population densities.
‚Ä¢ With a pixelized map of the population density of the United States, add together the resulting population within three miles of each point.

Again if you see a better way to accomplish this, please let me know!

I will eventually want to take a more advanced approach here to estimating the distributions of populations within Census Block groups, so would like to hear any suggestions you might have on ways to approach this.

As part of this project, I will want a copy of your code and an overview of how it works.

title: Data Analyst/Engineer for petroleum reservoir engineering workflow and asset evaluation
description:
Job Description:

We are a growing oil and gas mineral and royalty company seeking a skilled Data Analyst/Engineer to support our petroleum reservoir engineering workflow and financial analysis needs. We need a sharp, technical professional to streamline our processes, sync information across the organization, perform financial analysis, and help craft quarterly and annual presentations.

Our core tools include ComboCurve for reservoir engineering workflows and Excel for evaluating raw CSV outputs (well-level online cash flows and aggregate projected cash flows). The ideal candidate will combine coding expertise with financial acumen to enhance our deal evaluations, automate workflows, and provide actionable financial insights.

Key Responsibilities:

Analyze and organize raw CSV data from ComboCurve (well cash flows, aggregate projections, etc.)
Perform financial analysis on deal flows, including cash flow projections, ROI, and valuation metrics
Automate repetitive tasks in deal evaluation and financial modeling using scripts or tools
Sync and streamline data across the organization for consistency and accessibility
Create data-driven, financially focused quarterly and annual presentations for stakeholders
Collaborate with me (COO) to optimize workflows and refine financial decision-making processes
Professional Skills Required:

Coding: Proficiency in Python, SQL, or Spotfire for data manipulation and automation
Financial Analysis: Expertise in evaluating cash flows, ROI, NPV, IRR, and other financial metrics
Data Analysis: Ability to process large datasets, including CSV files from reservoir outputs
Excel: Advanced skills for financial modeling, data evaluation, and organization
Data Visualization: Capability to create clear, professional visuals highlighting technical and financial insights
Automation: Skill in scripting to streamline repetitive data and financial tasks
Database Management: Basic knowledge of syncing and structuring data across systems
Problem-Solving: Analytical mindset to improve workflows and financial outcomes
Communication: Ability to present technical and financial findings in an executive-friendly format
Bonus Skills (Preferred):

Familiarity with ComboCurve or petroleum reservoir engineering workflows
Experience in oil and gas financial analysis or mineral/royalty valuations
Proficiency with visualization tools like Power BI or Tableau for financial reporting
Who You Are:

A self-starter comfortable working remotely and independently
Able to collaborate with a busy executive to prioritize tasks and deliver results
Passionate about blending data mastery with financial insight to drive efficiency
How to Apply:

Please submit:

A brief cover letter explaining your experience in data analysis and financial modeling
Your resume or a link to your portfolio/LinkedIn
Examples of past work (e.g., scripts, financial models, or presentations) if available
Your hourly rate or preferred compensation structure
Applications must showcase both technical skills (e.g., Python, SQL) and financial analysis experience to be considered. I‚Äôm excited to find a talented partner to streamline our data and elevate our financial strategy‚Äîlet‚Äôs get to work!

title: Request non-public business dataset with predictor features for a target metric
description:
I am requesting a dataset for a data analysis project intended for inclusion in my professional portfolio, such as on my resume, LinkedIn, etc.   I require a dataset which has the following characteristics:
1. It has not been published publicly.
2. It is non-confidential.
3. The data originate from a real business.  To protect confidentiality, the dataset can be modified by multiplying each feature by a unique constant, shifting dates by an integral number of years, or changing class labels provided self-consistency is maintained in the dataset.  Ideally the dataset is unaltered.  If you suggest other transformations of the data, please so state in your proposal.
4. The dataset is structured and consists of continuous and categorical features and at least one corresponding target metric, which is of practical interest in business (e.g. customer features and conversion status).
5. At least a few of the features are expected to be significant or important predictors of the target metric.  Ideally, some of the features are known to be significant or important predictors of the target metric.

functional flow:

title: Head of Growth | Strategic Revenue & Acquisition Leader
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE:
We‚Äôre seeking a dynamic Head of Growth to drive revenue by optimizing customer acquisition, retention, and expansion. Your mission is to identify, scale, and leverage high-impact growth opportunities, fostering a culture of experimentation and results-driven innovation.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
1. Own and optimize both paid and organic acquisition channels (Meta, Google, SEO, partnerships).
2. Lead Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO) initiatives across key customer touchpoints.
3. Implement and scale CAC-efficient acquisition strategies.
4. Increase customer Lifetime Value (LTV) through targeted email, SMS, loyalty, and repeat purchase campaigns.
5. Develop and execute retention strategies to boost repeat purchases and optimize post-purchase experiences.
6. Lead continuous A/B and multivariate testing across ad creatives, landing pages, and product positioning.
7. Drive incremental revenue growth through innovative experiments.
8. Collaborate cross-functionally to test and implement new acquisition and engagement strategies.
9. Own and manage growth KPIs, ensuring accurate reporting and actionable insights.
10. Partner with data teams to forecast growth impact and optimize budget allocation.
11. Establish and refine attribution models and comprehensive reporting systems.
12. Manage, coach, and build a high-performance team of growth marketers, media buyers, email marketers, and data analysts.
13. Cultivate a results-driven culture focused on continuous growth and innovation.

QUALIFICATIONS FOR SUCCESS:
1. Proven track record driving significant growth in customer acquisition, retention, and revenue.
2. Expertise managing and scaling performance marketing channels effectively.
3. Strong background in CRO, A/B testing, and growth experimentation.
4. Exceptional analytical skills, capable of turning data insights into strategic decisions.
5. Experience leading and developing high-performance growth teams.

OUR IDEAL CANDIDATE IS:
1. Decisive: Makes swift, data-driven decisions in a fast-paced environment.
2. Reliable: Consistently delivers sustainable growth while balancing efficiency.
3. Adaptable: Quickly pivots strategies based on real-time insights and market changes.
4. Engaged: Passionate about fostering a culture of continuous improvement and experimentation.

KEY PERFORMANCE INDICATORS (KPIs):
Maintain Customer Acquisition Cost (CAC) at or below target thresholds.
Achieve blended ROAS targets.
Increase Landing Page Conversion Rate (CVR) by 15%+ YoY.
Grow Customer Lifetime Value (LTV) by 20%+ YoY.
Improve customer retention rate (repeat purchases) by 10% YoY.
Drive new customer revenue growth by 30% YoY.
Ensure a growth experimentation win rate of 25% or higher.

COMPENSATION:
- Competitive compensation based on experience.

- Performance-based incentives linked to growth outcomes.

- Clear pathway for professional development and team expansion opportunities.


Apply today and lead our strategic growth initiatives, shaping our future success!

title: Immediate Start: Power BI Data Engineer & Project Manager
description:
Startup Mode | Build Fast, Iterate, and Deliver an MVP in Real-Time Strategy Intelligence

I am building a power BI dashboard and reports that draws on market data + academic journals to synthesise themes and predict trends.

The reports are on both market and behavioural intelligence.

I‚Äôm looking for a Power BI Data Engineer & Project Manager who‚Äôs ready to own the build of a new Power BI Analytics reporting system, as well as take on the project management side of things which includes to recruit the team, and execute fast. This is a startup-style project, and we‚Äôre building a working MVP in one week‚Äîso you‚Äôll be making both technical and strategic decisions as we go.

You‚Äôll be responsible for:
‚úÖ Building the data infrastructure‚Äîpulling in peer-reviewed research & market intelligence and structuring it for analysis.
‚úÖ Recruiting & onboarding team members‚Äîhiring a Data Scientist, Power BI Developer, and Intelligence Analyst from Upwork to help you with the build and managing their hour allocations.
‚úÖ Overseeing project execution‚Äîallocating tasks, solving problems, and ensuring everything moves efficiently toward delivery.

‚è≥ Time Frame: 7 Days | Working MVP to onboard first test users
üìå Deliverables: Structured datasets, ML-ready models, Power BI dashboards, and executive-ready PDF reports.
üìä Possible Tools & Tech: SQL, Python (Pandas, BeautifulSoup, API requests), Power BI, Cloud Storage (AWS).

You will be managing the build, bringing in other expertise where needed.

There is an expectation you won't complete this alone and will instead be comfortable recruiting and instructing team members.

üîπ Your Role: What You‚Äôll Be Doing
üí° Day 1-2: Infrastructure Setup & Team Hiring
‚úî Set up SQL storage & data pipelines for structured storage.
‚úî Connect APIs for peer-reviewed research & market data sources.
‚úî Post job ads & recruit Data Scientist, Power BI Developer, and Intelligence Analyst.
‚úî Onboard team members and allocate their 32-hour blocks effectively.

üí° Day 3-4: Data Structuring & Initial Processing
‚úî Work with the Data Scientist to structure peer-reviewed & market data.
‚úî Ensure data is clean, validated, and ready for Power BI integration.
‚úî Unblock dependencies so team members can work in parallel.

üí° Day 5-6: Refinement, QA & Power BI Integration
‚úî Conduct QA on structured data and validate ML model inputs.
‚úî Support the Power BI Developer with data integration & visualization setup.
‚úî Ensure data models are accurate, scalable, and business-ready.

üí° Day 7: Final Review & Delivery
‚úî Validate final datasets, dashboards, and ML outputs.
‚úî Ensure Power BI dashboards are fully functional & executive-ready.
‚úî Oversee final report integration with the Intelligence Analyst.
‚úî Prepare for user testing & next iteration planning.

title: Review of paper for Electrochemistry
description:
I have one paper that need to submitted soon. This paper is about electrochemical sensor that detects nitrate, phosphate, and potassum. We have also developed soil battery and low power electroncs.
The energy generated from the soil battery, powers the low power electroncis and this low power electroncis reads the data from the electrochemcial sensor. The senor and the electrocnis is
optimized such a way that it has the capability to correct the sensor drift due to temperature variance.

I need constructive review feedback to improve the mansucript quality. The target is to publish paper 1) ACS Environmental Science & Technology /ACS Electrochemistry (First priority)
2) ACS Journal of Agricultural and Food Chemistry (Second priority)
3) IEEE transactions on agrifood and electronics (last option)
The supplementary do not have much important data, so you might not need it for judging of this paper.
I need someone who has good experience in electrochemistry background having proven publication track record in top electrochemistry journal such as Electrochemica acta, Sensors and Actuators B
Biosensor and bioelectronics, ACS analytical Chemistry, Applied Materials and Interfaces RSC Analyst/Advance, LOC, ECS journals, (ACS, RSC, and advanced family journals)
Deliverables :
Constructive feedback so that if the feed back is taken to improve the paper, even a very harsh reviewer (who is willing to reject most of the paper) will very much likely to accept this paper.
Also, if you suggest any experiment in the feedback , please give reference to some article who has done this so that I can do it on my end.

title: Marketing Research Analyst - Mobile Fuel Delivery
description:
We are seeking an experienced and resourceful Market Research Analyst to lead an in-depth study into the diesel mobile fuel delivery market in Australia. This research will focus on understanding customer fuel preferences, analyzing competitor strategies, and assessing regulatory and operational frameworks. Your work will inform our strategic plan for entering and differentiating our diesel fleet fueling service, particularly for government and commercial fleets.

Key Responsibilities:

Market Analysis:

Conduct detailed research on the Australian mobile fuel delivery market, with an emphasis on diesel fueling for fleet and government vehicles.

Identify and segment key customer groups (e.g., government fleets, public transport, commercial fleets) and quantify market size and growth potential.

Competitive Analysis:

Analyze existing competitors in Australia, including service models, pricing strategies, technological solutions, and market positioning.

Benchmark global models (e.g., Booster Fuels, EZFill) and identify gaps/opportunities for a differentiated diesel service in Australia.

Regulatory & Stakeholder Engagement:

Research and map relevant Australian regulations (e.g., AS1940, AS2809, local zoning laws) that impact mobile fuel delivery operations.

Contact and interview relevant government agencies (e.g., SafeWork NSW, Environmental Protection Agencies) and industry bodies to understand regulatory challenges and potential approval pathways.

Reach out to fleet operators, government departments, and private companies to gather insights on their current fueling practices, pain points, and requirements.

Reporting & Recommendations:

Synthesize research findings into comprehensive reports with actionable insights and strategic recommendations.

Develop a detailed market entry plan, including pilot program design and potential technology integrations (such as AI-driven compliance and tracking systems).

Required Qualifications & Skills:

Proven experience in market research, preferably within the fuel, energy, or transportation sectors.

Strong knowledge of the Australian regulatory environment, particularly regarding fuel storage, transportation, and environmental compliance.

Excellent communication skills, with the ability to conduct interviews, negotiate access to data, and build relationships with government agencies and industry stakeholders.

Demonstrated analytical skills and proficiency in synthesizing complex information into clear, actionable insights.

Ability to work independently and manage project timelines effectively.

title: Financial Analyst Needed to Identify Discrepancies in Line of Credit
description:
About Us:
We are a small business that has been operating for four years. Recently, we underwent a partnership change, and we are now focused on ensuring financial transparency and accuracy in our operations. We are looking for a detail-oriented professional to help us reconcile our financial records and identify discrepancies in our line of credit (LOC).

The Problem:
After a recent review, we discovered that $40,000 is missing from the available credit in our LOC. We need help tracing and reconciling every order to ensure that vendor costs and accrued interest are properly reimbursed into the LOC. Our workflow involves paying vendors via bill.com (linked to the LOC) within 30 days, while customers take up to 90 days to pay. Once customers pay, we transfer only the vendor cost and accrued interest back into the LOC.

title: Power BI / Fabric/ MS SQL/ Lakehouse / Azure Data Scientist or Analyst Needed
description:
We are an analytics company in the legaltech space. We've worked with a front end analytics developer to develop a number of very sophisticated reports in Power BI. He has also developed our data models in PowerBi, permissions, lakehouses, Fabric instances, and integrated PowerBI with an MSSQL data warehouse. Some of the visuals are written in Python and embedded in PowerBI. All of this gets embedded in web pages and our CTO has developed JS scripts to interact with the visuals and reports.

So the setup is complex. He's overbooked and no longer can meet the demands of our sprints. We need someone who can quickly review the codebase, structure and setup and get into a sprint cadence of 3-4 weeks. One of the critical issues we are facing is the way he set it up, all of the data models and visuals are under his personal user account as a superadmin. The very first task is to restructure the accounts and system so that there is a shared permissions structure at an enterprise level - so that multiple admins and moderators can have permissions to change the data models, visuals, reports, etc., without triggering any security freezes.  

There are also performance issues so we can use help improving the performance of the reports, which are fairly slow.

If you have the expertise to quickly learn the structure by reviewing the models, measures, python code, permissions, etc, and you have the bandwidhth, interest and passion for a very excited, groundbreaking project, please apply. We would start late Feb/ early March.

Ideally you will work along side him and we'll have him stay on and help with front end stuff and knowledge transfer. Or it's possible you will have to go it alone with very little information if he can't commit to tighter deadlines. We need someone who is super adept and confident to work in either scenario.

title: Econometrics Small Case Study (Assignment) ‚Äì Undergraduate Level (R & Data Analysis)
description:
I am looking for an experienced econometrics tutor or data analyst to solve and answer a case study for an introductory econometrics course at the undergraduate level. The case study involves quantitative analysis, regression modeling, hypothesis testing, and data interpretation using R.

The case study is focused on explaining firm profitability using a dataset extracted from Compustat, containing financial data of U.S. non-financial companies. You will be required to conduct statistical analysis, create visualizations, and provide detailed answers to the questions outlined in the case study.

Scope of Work:
- Compute summary statistics for key financial variables.
Perform correlation analysis and visualize relationships between variables.
- Conduct univariate and multivariate linear regression analysis (OLS).
- Test hypotheses using statistical significance tests (including one-sided tests).
- Examine industry effects by incorporating dummy variables into regression models.
- Implement binary response models (LPM & Logit) to analyze dividend payments.
- Provide interpretable and well-structured answers to each question, including regression equations, interpretations of coefficients, and discussion of model fit.
- Deliver a well-documented R script that produces the required outputs.

Requirements:
- Background in econometrics, statistics, and data analysis.
- Proficiency in R programming (packages such as lmtest, sandwich, ggplot2, margins, stargazer, etc.).
Experience with regression modeling, hypothesis testing, and data visualization.
- Ability to explain results in a clear, structured, and academic manner.
- Familiarity with heteroskedasticity correction and other regression assumptions.

Deliverables:
1. Written Report (PDF): Well-structured responses to all case study questions, including tables and figures.
2. R Script (Commented): Fully reproducible code that generates all results and visualizations.
Deadline:
The final submission is due on February 24, 2025, 13:00 (Amsterdam time), so I require the completed work by February 24, 2025, to allow for any revisions.

title: XML Conversion Expert
description:

Remote Work
5 days a week

Job Summary:
The XML Conversion Analyst is responsible for analyzing, converting, and validating structured and unstructured data into XML formats. This role involves transforming various file types (such as Word, PDF, and HTML) into XML using industry standards like NISO JATS, DITA, TEI, LegalDocML, or other relevant schemas. Data Conversion & Transformation:

Validate XML against schemas and troubleshoot errors.

Automation & Scripting:
Develop scripts and automation workflows for large-scale XML conversion.
Use technologies like XSLT, XPath, Python, Java, VBA, or PowerShell to streamline the conversion process.

Quality Assurance & Validation:
Perform QA checks, debugging, and validation to ensure XML outputs meet industry standards.
Review and correct structural and logical inconsistencies in converted XML files.

Collaboration & Documentation:
Collaborate with IT teams, content managers, and developers to improve XML workflows.
Document processes, best practices, and troubleshooting guidelines for XML conversion.

Industry Standards & Compliance:
Ensure adherence to JATS, DITA, DocBook, LegalDocML, DITA OT Toolkit or other XML-based standards.
Stay updated with emerging trends in structured document workflows and XML publishing.

title: Non Organic Download Analytics
description:
We are seeking an experienced Analytics Specialist to drive insights from non-organic download campaigns. In this role, you will be responsible for tracking and analyzing key performance indicators (KPIs) related to our marketing efforts, specifically from external video content (e.g., TikTok). The ideal candidate will work closely with our development team to ensure accurate data integration and reporting, leveraging existing tools like Adjust, Mixpanel, and AppsFlyer.

**Key Responsibilities:**

- **Campaign Tracking & Analysis:**  
  - Monitor and analyze non-organic download data originating from video content (e.g., TikTok campaigns).
  - Track metrics such as downloads, activations, active subscribers, and revenue generated from each video campaign (e.g., Video A).

- **Collaboration with Development Team:**  
  - Work alongside our development team to ensure proper integration of tracking solutions.
  - Provide technical guidance on leveraging existing analytics tools (Adjust, Mixpanel, AppsFlyer) to capture relevant data.

- **Data Integration & Reporting:**  
  - Develop and maintain dashboards and reports that provide insights into campaign performance.
  - Identify trends, anomalies, and opportunities for optimization based on data analysis.
  
- **Tool Management & Optimization:**  
  - Leverage and optimize existing analytics tools rather than building custom solutions from scratch.
  - Stay current with best practices in digital analytics and recommend improvements in tracking methodologies.

**Qualifications:**

- **Experience:**  
  - Proven experience in digital analytics, with a focus on tracking non-organic or performance marketing campaigns.
  - Hands-on experience with tools like Adjust, Mixpanel, AppsFlyer, or similar analytics platforms.
  
- **Technical Skills:**  
  - Strong understanding of digital marketing metrics, tracking, and data integration.
  - Experience working with development teams to implement tracking solutions.
  - Familiarity with API integrations and data aggregation techniques.

- **Analytical Skills:**  
  - Ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
  - Strong problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
  
- **Communication:**  
  - Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  - Ability to clearly present data insights and recommendations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

**Additional Information:**

- This role does not require the creation of new tracking tools; instead, you will optimize and integrate existing solutions.
- Opportunity to work in a dynamic and collaborative environment where data-driven decisions shape business strategy.
- Competitive salary and benefits package.

If you are passionate about leveraging data to drive marketing success and have a knack for integrating analytics tools, we would love to hear from you!

---

**How to Apply:**  
Please send your resume and a brief cover letter outlining your relevant experience.

title: Fraud Analyst Needed for Transaction Data Review
description:
We are seeking an experienced fraud analyst to assess transaction data, focusing on upsells, decline rates, and IP information. The ideal candidate will analyze patterns and provide actionable insights to minimize fraud risk while optimizing legitimate transactions.

The ideal candidate will have experience looking at transactional data and reviewing the following and assessing from the data where there is fraud:

Ways to Find Fraud
1. Chargeback Rate
2. Upsell Rates
3. AOV
4. Decline Rate
5. Partials
6. Card Types
7. Card Bins
8. IP addresses
9. Email Addresses
10. Dirty Verification

title: Director of Operations & Content Strategy - Scale a High-Impact Media Machine
description:
Director of Content Strategy & Operations ‚Äì Scale a High-Impact Media Machine

I am looking for an elite executor who can take full ownership of my content operations while ensuring that our content is engaging, high-value, and strategically optimized for performance.

This is not a virtual assistant role. This is a leadership position where you will oversee our entire media team, enforce accountability, and ensure that we are not just producing content‚Äîbut making it perform at the highest level.
Every piece of content must be built with a purpose‚Äîwhether it‚Äôs driving audience engagement, retention, or conversions.
If you have the leadership skills to run an operation and the creative mindset to think like a content strategist, this is for you.

Your Core Responsibilities
1. Content Performance & Strategy
* Oversee not just the execution of content but its effectiveness across multiple platforms.
* Ensure team optimizes raw footage into videos, articles, tweets, and pictures for maximum engagement, watch time, and retention on YouTube, TikTok, Instagram, LinkedIn, and Twitter (X).
* Ensure all content aligns with our brand voice, storytelling approach, and audience expectations.
* Provide direct feedback to editors, videographer, me, and repurposing specialists based on data-driven insights.
* Stay ahead of trends, platform updates, and algorithm shifts to constantly improve performance.
2. Media Team Leadership & Execution
* Manage a team of me, videographers, editors, data analysts, and repurposing specialists.
* Set clear expectations and hold people accountable‚Äîthis is a high-performance team, not a casual environment.
* Build a content machine that consistently delivers high-quality, optimized content.
* Manage all communications, deadlines, and workflow so that I don‚Äôt have to.
3. Content Tracking, Scheduling & Optimization
* Own the content calendar across YouTube, Instagram, LinkedIn, TikTok, Facebook, and Twitter (X).
* Ensure all content is scheduled, queued, and optimized to perform at the highest level.
* Track content performance and make real-time adjustments based on data.
* Plan and execute live-streaming strategies‚Äîdecide when and where I go live for maximum impact.
4. Quality Control & Approval Flow
* You learn my style and standards.
* Ensure that nothing reaches me unless it‚Äôs already been checked, cleaned up, and meets my standards.
* If team members fail KPIs, you step in first, solve issues, and then bring me solutions.
* Ensure captions, thumbnails, pacing, and edits are designed for maximum engagement.
5. System & Workflow Optimization
* Build seamless backend organization in Google Drive, Notion, Asana, and other tools.
* Remove inefficiencies and bottlenecks‚Äîthis role is about constant improvement.
* Ensure that we have a 5-week backlog of content so we are always ahead of the game.
6. Communication, Leadership & Proactive Execution
* Provide proactive updates‚ÄîI should never have to ask for status reports.
* Train, instruct, and enforce execution across the team.
* Manage scheduling, messaging, and priorities as if this were your own media brand.

Compensation & Pay Structure - this is the highest paying role on our team. Congratulations.  The second highest paying job role is $3,000.
* First month: $3,000
* After 30 days: $3,500
* After 60 days: $4,000 (permanent salary cap unless milestones are hit)
* Performance-Based Raise: After 9 months of consistent execution, a 20% pay increase ($4,800/month) will be considered based on performance, execution, and results.

I am open to milestone-based raises for someone who delivers at a high level, leads effectively, and proves they can grow with the company. This isn‚Äôt about time served‚Äîit‚Äôs about real execution and impact.


What This Role Will Do
The Director of Content & Operations will build, automate, and manage the entire content operation. This person will ensure all content is structured, distributed, and optimized for maximum engagement‚Äîwithout needing micromanagement.
You will be responsible for:
* Managing my content ecosystem‚Äîoverseeing the execution of the entire media team.
* Setting up workflows & automation to ensure zero bottlenecks in the content process.
* Scheduling & publishing content on LinkedIn, Twitter, YouTube, Instagram, and TikTok.
* Ensuring everything is on-brand, engaging, and optimized for audience growth.
* Overseeing performance tracking & insights‚Äîworking with the Analytics Specialist to ensure we are making data-driven decisions.
* Holding the team accountable‚Äîmaking sure Videographers, Editors, Copywriters, and Repurposing Specialists are executing at a high level.
* Streamlining operations with Notion, Asana, Trello, Google Drive, Slack, and AI tools.
* Managing approvals and quality control‚Äînothing goes live without final review.
* Working directly with me‚Äîmaking sure everything is aligned with my vision, voice, and brand.
* Leading the team with high-level communication and accountability‚Äîensuring we move at the same speed every single day.

Key Skills Required
This is not a VA role. This is a Director-Level Position that requires:
1. Leadership & Accountability ‚Äì You will oversee an entire team, enforce deadlines, and ensure executionwithout micromanagement.
2. Social Media & Brand Strategy ‚Äì You must understand how to grow an audience, structure content, and drive engagement across platforms.
3. Process Automation & Workflow Creation ‚Äì You must be able to build systems in Asana, Zapier, Notion, Google Drive, and scheduling tools to keep content flowing automatically.
4. Content Distribution & Optimization ‚Äì You need to know what works and why across LinkedIn, Twitter, YouTube, Instagram, and TikTok.
5. Attention to Detail & Brand Consistency ‚Äì Everything must be on-brand, from copy to visuals to post timing.
6. Data-Driven Decision Making ‚Äì You will track performance, analyze metrics, and ensure we are making data-backed improvements.
7. Project Management & Execution ‚Äì You will set goals, break them down into tasks, and ensure deadlines are met without excuses.
8. Ability to Work at High Speed ‚Äì This is a fast-paced, high-performance role. If you cannot operate at a relentless execution speed, this is not for you.

Who This Role is For
You should apply if you:
* Have 5+ years of experience managing content teams, social media growth, or operations.
* Can run a team & workflow without being told what to do.
* Are obsessed with content, branding, and execution.
* Are highly organized and love building automation & efficiency into workflows.
* Have managed teams of 5+ people in a fast-paced media, social, or content-driven company.
* Understand how to scale and optimize content distribution.

Who This Role is NOT For
This is not a basic VA, social media manager, or content repurposing role.
* If you need constant direction, this is not for you.
* If you can‚Äôt move at high speed, this is not for you.
* If you struggle with execution & leadership, this is not for you.
* If you don‚Äôt deeply understand content & social media growth, this is not for you.

How to Apply
1. Submit your resume and include examples of your previous work.
2. Tell me how you have built and managed a high-performance content team before.
3. Explain your experience with automation & workflow optimization.
4. Give an example of a content system you‚Äôve built and scaled.

Quick Rundown of Roles
Tevin (Videographer) ‚Äì Captures high-quality video content daily, ensuring strong storytelling and brand visuals. Uploads footage to the Director of Content Strategy & Operationsfor distribution.
Content Operations Lead (Director of Content Strategy & OperationsManager) ‚Äì Organizes content, assigns tasks, ensures execution, collects and submits all deliverables to Bennett for review, and handles posting. Manages workflow, tracking, and accountability across the team.
Content Editor ‚Äì Edits raw footage into short-form (TikTok, Reels, Shorts) and long-form (YouTube) videos. Ensures polished, high-quality edits before submission.
Repurposing Specialist ‚Äì Extracts key moments from videos and creates additional content (tweets, carousels, audiograms, quote graphics) tailored for different platforms.
Copywriter & Brand Strategist ‚Äì Writes LinkedIn posts, Twitter threads, Instagram captions, and email copy in Bennett‚Äôs voice. Ensures all content aligns with branding and messaging.
Analytics & Insights Specialist ‚Äì Tracks content performance, analyzes engagement, and provides data-driven insights to optimize future content. Reports findings to Director of Content Strategy & Operationsand Bennett.
Bennett (CEO & Final Reviewer) ‚Äì Provides high-level strategy, final content approval, and audience engagement. Ensures everything meets the ‚ÄúBennett Standard‚Äù before going live. YOUR ROLE  is the heartbeat of the team ‚Äì Keeps everything organized, moving, and optimized for execution.

Trial Process ‚Äì Prove You Can Lead This System
Before hiring someone on full-time, I‚Äôm running a paid one-week trial to confirm the right fit. This will be your opportunity to show that you can take ownership, enforce execution, and optimize this system: my hope is that you shine!

Trial Tasks ‚Äì What You Need to Prove This Week
1. Systems and Workflow Execution
* Set up and refine content tracking, workflow, and storage systems.
* Ensure the videographer follows a structured upload process that is organized and trackable.
* Build a scalable system for the editor so once hired, they seamlessly plug in.
2. Leadership and High-Quality Output
* Prove that under your leadership, the output meets my standards and is something I would personally approve.
* Track daily footage uploads and ensure everything is properly labeled, accessible, and structured.
* Assess the systems you build, then recommend improvements to enhance efficiency and simplify onboarding.
3. Readiness and Content Pipeline
* This operation does not launch until we have five weeks of content ready to go.
* By the end of this week BEFORE END OF FEBRUARY 2025, we should have a fully operational system where every team member knows their role, executes at a high level, and trusts the process. This is the first hire I am making, as I want you building the systems out for the others to come into. I have concepts already mapped out for you.
* Weekly meetings must be structured, productive, and geared toward constant improvement.
4. Managing Me and Executing My Vision
* Schedule a daily check-in with me to update progress and discuss ideas.
* Show that you can handle incoming ideas and requests without letting quality slip elsewhere.
* Take ownership and execute what I give you without needing reminders or constant oversight.
5. Leadership and Team Communication
* Schedule, announce, coordinate, and lead a team meeting.
* Enforce participation and set the tone for the team.
* Demonstrate your ability to gain respect, demand accountability, and drive execution.
6. Ownership and Reporting
* Send me daily progress updates without needing to be asked.
* Identify and resolve bottlenecks before they become issues.

What Happens Next
If you execute at the highest level, you will transition into a full-time role at $4,000 USD per month after a 60-day ramp-up period. If you cannot prove this in a week, this role is not for you.

Who I Am & Where I Come From
* Self-made. Nothing handed. Scaled Park Business Capital from 3 to 40+ people.
* Built sales systems & processes that transform careers, not just jobs.
* I don‚Äôt believe in micromanaging‚ÄîI hire the right people and let them do what they do best.
* I‚Äôm not an influencer‚Äîjust someone who actually wins.

The Vision & Why This Role Matters
This isn‚Äôt a personal brand project. This is a media powerhouse.
* The content we create will be seen by millions and shift how people think and operate.
* We aren‚Äôt just posting to post‚Äîeverything is intentional.
* Execution is everything‚Äîfrom how I show up, to how the videographer captures it, to how the editor refines it, to how the team repurposes and distributes it.
If you are lead management and are the 1 in charge of the operations, then every single person on the team needs to feel your presence, your passion, and you need to be able to speak like me, on my behalf- and I need to trust you wholeheartedly. You need to be able to speak like me, think like me, and execute without hesitation.

Think Alex Hormozi, Gary Vee, Andy Elliott, Grant Cardone‚Äîthis is not just about social media, this is about building a first-of-its-kind sales movement.

This is not a task-based VA job. This is a leadership role in running a high-impact media operation.

If you hesitate, this isn‚Äôt for you. If you‚Äôre ready to execute at a high level‚Äîlet‚Äôs build something legendary.
Hiring ASAP.

title: data analyst to implement OLAP & advanced prediction for Data Warehousing

I am working on a research paper focused on data warehousing (DW) and efficient querying of large datasets using SQL. The original paper primarily discusses SQL-based implementations but does not explicitly cover Online Analytical Processing (OLAP).
I would like to extend this research by incorporating OLAP techniques to enhance data analysis and multidimensional querying. Additionally, I aim to introduce new predictive insights beyond what is covered in the paper to serve as a contribution to the research.
Project Details:
- I already have the dataset, which was originally collected from four sources: Weather Underground, NASA's Data Access Viewer, Flightradar24 and FlightStats.
- The goal is to structure and process the dataset for OLAP-based analysis.
- Implement advanced predictive analytics beyond what is discussed in the paper.
- Provide insights and recommendations on the best tools and technologies for handling OLAP queries and predictive modeling.
What I Need:
- Assistance in integrating OLAP techniques for multidimensional analysis.
- Developing additional predictive models to generate new insights.
- Guidance on tools and technologies suitable for handling large-scale OLAP queries and predictions.
I have attached the original research paper that I am working on for reference. Please review it and let me know how you can assist with implementing OLAP and introducing new predictive analytics as a contribution to the research.
If you have expertise in data warehousing, OLAP, SQL, predictive analytics, and large-scale data processing, I‚Äôd love to hear how you can contribute to this project.

Our goal is to build an impactful and highly useful dashboard in Looker that not only provides a high-level summary of sustainability data but also enables deep analytical exploration (drill-downs).

What we need help with:
- Strategic setup & integration: You should be familiar with Google Cloud Platform and Looker (data is stored in BigQuery) to ensure a smooth and effective setup. However, getting everything ‚Äòtechnically perfect‚Äô is less important than ensuring the data delivers valuable insights.
- Dashboard & visualization: Develop a clear and actionable dashboard that highlights key sustainability metrics (e.g., total CO‚ÇÇ, costs, supplier overview) while allowing users to drill down into specific areas for deeper analysis.
- Analytical approach: We need someone who goes beyond the technical setup and can think about what questions the data should answer. You will be expected to contribute ideas on which key metrics, dimensions, and analyses matter most for understanding and improving sustainability efforts.
- Advisory role: Provide input on how to structure and model the data to uncover insights and offer fresh perspectives on sustainability.

Who we are looking for:
- Business & analytical mindset: You understand how to extract real business value from data and can suggest the right types of analyses and data manipulations.
- Technical expertise: Strong experience with Google Cloud Platform, particularly BigQuery and Looker.
- Sustainability knowledge (a plus): Experience with CO‚ÇÇ emissions data, environmental calculations, or sustainability-related analytics is highly valued.
- Communication skills: Ability to explain complex data insights in a clear and engaging way, both visually and in written documentation.

Key responsibilities:
- Review existing data structure and sources to ensure they are optimized for impactful insights in Looker.
- Set up LookML models and relationships that support meaningful analytics and storytelling.
- Design a dashboard that provides both high-level KPIs and granular drill-downs for further investigation.
- Ensure the dashboard is intuitive and adaptable, allowing for easy updates as new data becomes available.
- Suggest ways to improve data collection and structuring to enhance long-term analytical value.

How to apply:
Please provide:
- A short description of your experience with Looker, BigQuery, and Google Cloud.
- Examples of past dashboards or projects you‚Äôve built‚Äîideally where data was used to drive business decisions, not just for reporting.

- Estimated time requirements and your availability.

Timeline & scope:

- We aim to have a first working version within a few weeks but are flexible on exact timing.
- If this collaboration goes well, there‚Äôs potential for ongoing work.

Budget:
Please provide your hourly rate or a fixed price proposal. We are open to discussing based on your expertise and approach.

We‚Äôre looking for someone who can turn data into actionable sustainability insights. If you‚Äôre passionate about making complex data meaningful and useful, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

title: Transportation Researcher Needed for Vehicle Crash Data Analysis
description:
Seek a Transportation researcher to identify gaps in MMUCC (Model Minimum Uniform Crash Criteria) crash data with state-level Law Enforcement Agencies (LEAs) in the US.

Such gaps often stem from issues related to data completeness and data sharing. Here‚Äôs a breakdown of the key challenges and potential solutions:

1. Data Completeness Issues
Challenges:
Inconsistent Data Entry: LEAs may not collect all MMUCC-recommended fields, leading to missing or incomplete data.
Varied Reporting Standards: States may have unique crash report formats that don‚Äôt align with MMUCC.
Standardized Digital Reporting: Implement state-mandated electronic crash reporting systems with required MMUCC fields.

2. Data Sharing Challenges
Challenges:
Lack of Centralized Systems: Many states have separate databases that aren‚Äôt integrated, making cross-agency data sharing difficult.
Interoperability Issues: Different states and LEAs use various reporting platforms that may not communicate with each other.
Data Format Inconsistencies: Differences in how crash data is recorded (e.g., structured vs. unstructured data) create integration challenges.

Deliverable;
Your output will be a technical paper clearly identifying gaps in current MMUCC model data sharing and data completeness within existing software offerings.
Your report will contain the top 3 commercial or government software offerings with a mapping of Core Components of MMUCC Crash Data
with integrate FARS data elements at the crash, vehicle, and person level found on NHTSA‚Äôs Fatality Injury Reporting System Tool (FIRST).

Gig pays $25 and must be highly technical for a technical managerial audience.
Output will be a Word document of approximately 20 pages including 4 infographics to explain the standard & gaps where applicable.
skills: ['Microsoft Excel', 'Data Analysis', 'IBM SPSS', 'Neo4j', 'Search Engine Optimization', 'Python', 'Data Science']

title: Development of Integrated Financial Reporting & Operational KPI Dashboard
description:
We are seeking an experienced data analytics professional to design and implement an integrated Financial Reporting and Operational KPI Dashboard. The objective is to create a "single source of truth" for our financial and operational data, ensuring accuracy, consistency, and efficiency across reporting processes.

Project Overview:
This project will be delivered in three phases:

(1) Phase 1: Financial Reporting ‚Äì Management Accounts & Board Pack

(2) Phase 2: Operational KPI Reporting

(3) Phase 3: Other Departmental Reporting (Details to follow post Phase 1 & 2)

We aim to move quickly with Phases 1 and 2, without Phase 3 delaying project initiation.

Phase 1: Financial Reporting Requirements
Key Deliverables:

- Consolidated Monthly Management Accounts:
- Integrate data from multiple Xero accounts.
- Ensure seamless financial data consolidation without discrepancies.

Profit & Loss Analysis by Department:
- Own Clinics
- Franchise
- Pharma
- Resolve overlap across Xero accounts (e.g., shared data between GAD Operations and GAD Pharma).

Profit & Loss by Own Clinic Locations:
- Manage data across 7 current sites, scaling to 30+ sites within two years.
- Consolidate data coded by location in shared Xero accounts.

Data Controls:
- Implement rigorous controls to validate integration accuracy and completeness.

Phase 2: Operational KPI Dashboard Requirements

Sample KPIs (to be refined during consultation):
- Franchise Operations:
- Sales by location and product type
- Resource utilisation
- Average transactional value
- Customer retention
- Budget vs. prior year comparisons
- Prescriptions issued
- Staff costs by clinic (attendance-based)
- Discounts given

Own Clinics:
- Similar KPIs to Franchise Operations
- Pharma Operations:
- Sales by customer type
- Customer sign-ups, approvals, and pending applications

Additional KPIs:
- Flexibility to incorporate new metrics as needed

Phase 3: Other Departmental Reports

Details will be defined by department heads but may include:
- Franchise Operations:
- Franchisee sign-up progress
- Incident logs (e.g., Health & Safety)
- Staff numbers
- Cancelled appointments
- Active hours

Own Clinics:
- Similar KPIs to Franchise Operations

Pharma Operations:
- Orders processed
- Staff time per order
- Stock levels and ordering recommendations

HR:
- Staff retention rates
- Vacancy progress
- Benchmarking staff remuneration

Current Data Infrastructure Overview:
Primary Data Sources:
- Xero: Financial data (11 accounts, scaling to 30+ in two years).
- Zenoti (POS/CRM): Sales, staff costs, discounts, and partner payments.
- Pharma Website: Third-party orders, stock tracking (via Mintsoft), Stripe payments.
- Shopify: Online sales, Stripe integration.

Current Reporting Workflow:
- Data exported to Google Sheets via Coupler.io.
- Manual data entry for specific KPIs (e.g., staff attendance costs, franchise gross sales).
- Consolidated Management Accounts and Board Packs generated manually.

Key Expectations:
- A centralised, automated dashboard with minimal manual intervention.
- Seamless integration with Xero, Zenoti, Shopify, Stripe, Pharma Website.
- Ability to handle multi-source data consolidation.
- Scalable infrastructure for future expansion.
- User-friendly interface for non-technical stakeholders.
- Robust data validation and control mechanisms.

Proposal Requirements:
Please include the following in your proposal:
- Your approach to developing this dashboard.
- Estimated timeline and cost breakdown.
- Relevant experience with similar projects.

We are excited to hear from professionals with proven expertise in financial and operational data analytics. If you're confident in delivering a robust and scalable solution, we'd love to collaborate.

Looking forward to receiving your proposal!
