title: Lead Economic Impact Consultant for Industrial & Energy Sectors
description:
Description:
We are seeking an experienced Economic Impact Consultant to lead a six-month study assessing the economic contribution of a major company's downstream assets and future investments. The study will quantify direct, indirect, and induced economic impacts, assess GDP contributions, employment effects, and In-Country Value (ICV), and provide insights for government discussions on natural gas pricing and allocation.

This role requires an expert-level consultant to lead the economic modeling, analysis, and strategic assessments. A team of analysts will be on the ground to support data collection, ensuring access to local financial, operational, and market data. The consultant will focus on designing the methodology, conducting impact assessments, and engaging with stakeholders at a strategic level.

Key Responsibilities:
Lead the Economic Impact Study, defining methodology, research approach, and analysis.
Develop economic models to quantify economic contributions under various scenarios.
Conduct scenario analysis on different operational and investment strategies.
Provide strategic guidance to on-the-ground analysts collecting financial and operational data.
Engage with stakeholders, including industry leaders, policymakers, and investment authorities.
Deliver a comprehensive final report, an Excel-based economic model, and an executive summary presentation.
Present findings to key stakeholders, ensuring alignment with project objectives.
Provide weekly progress updates and address any project challenges proactively.
Qualifications & Experience:
10+ years of experience in economic impact analysis, public policy research, or industrial economics.
Strong background in economic modeling, forecasting, and scenario planning.
Sector expertise in energy, petrochemicals, manufacturing, or infrastructure.
Experience engaging with government, regulatory bodies, or investment stakeholders.
Strong stakeholder engagement and presentation skills.
Proficiency in Excel-based economic models, data visualization, and structured reporting.
Ability to coordinate remotely with local analysts conducting data collection.
Deliverables:
Final Report (Executive Summary + White Paper with Visual Infographics).
Excel-Based Economic Model (Scenario-based impact analysis).
Stakeholder Presentation (Findings summary for leadership & key decision-makers).
Short Video Summary (Optional).
Project Structure & Compensation:
Location: Remote, with coordination of on-the-ground analysts conducting data collection.
Timeline: 6 months (fixed-term contract).
Compensation: Competitive rate based on experience; milestone-based payments preferred.
How to Apply:
Interested candidates should submit:

A brief proposal detailing relevant experience.
Sample reports or case studies of previous economic impact studies.
Availability and rate expectations.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst for Construction Data & Forecasting
description:
Title: Business Intelligence Analyst for Construction Data & Forecasting (Contract)
Job Description:
We are a high-end residential construction company in San Francisco looking for an experienced Business Intelligence Analyst to analyze historical project data, develop automated dashboards, and create predictive financial models for future planning.

This is a 3‚Äì6 month remote contract with a clear focus on project cost analysis, forecasting, and performance tracking. The ideal candidate has experience in construction or real estate analytics and can deliver actionable insights to improve project efficiency and profitability.

Scope of Work:
Data Analysis & Insights

Review past project costs, labor efficiency, and profitability trends.
Identify patterns in cost overruns, scheduling delays, and subcontractor performance.
Develop predictive models for job costing and future project pricing.
Dashboards & Reporting

Build real-time dashboards for tracking profitability, cost breakdowns, and KPIs.
Use Google Data Studio, Looker Studio, or Power BI for visualization.
Provide summary reports with key insights and recommendations.
Data Cleaning & Automation

Extract, clean, and organize data from JobTread, QuickBooks, and spreadsheets.
Streamline reporting processes to reduce manual data entry.
Implement ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to enhance data accuracy.
Forecasting & Financial Modeling

Create cost projection models to estimate future labor, materials, and profit margins.
Forecast cash flow and budget needs for upcoming projects.
Provide data-backed recommendations for pricing strategy and cost control.
Deliverables:
Interactive dashboards for ongoing project performance tracking.
Data reports & cost analysis summaries with key insights.
Predictive pricing and financial forecasting models.
Automated reporting workflows for long-term efficiency.
Ideal Candidate:
3+ years experience in business intelligence, data analytics, or construction financial analysis.
Experience with construction or real estate data (preferred).
Proficiency in Google Data Studio, Looker Studio, Power BI, or Tableau.
Advanced Excel/Google Sheets skills (pivot tables, financial modeling).
Experience working with JobTread, QuickBooks, or construction software (preferred).
Strong ability to interpret financial data, identify trends, and build predictive models.
Clear communicator who can present insights effectively.
Project Details:
Duration: 3‚Äì6 months, project-based.
Location: 100% remote.
Budget: Competitive, based on experience.
Hours: Flexible, but must meet deadlines.
How to Apply:
Please submit:

A brief note on your experience with construction analytics.
Examples of past dashboards, reports, or forecasting models you have built.
A short explanation of how you would approach project cost forecasting in construction.
Priority will be given to candidates with construction-specific experience.

We look forward to reviewing your application.

title: HR Analyst Training and Skills Development
description:
I am seeking a skilled professional to train me in becoming an HR Analyst. With 2 years of core HR experience, I am looking to enhance my skills and knowledge in this specific area. The training should focus on key competencies such as data analysis, employee relations, HR metrics, and strategic planning. Your guidance will help me transition smoothly into this role and understand the analytical aspects essential for HR decision-making.

Core HR Analyst Skills:

Data Analysis & Reporting:  This is paramount.  Look for trainers proficient in:

HRIS (Human Resource Information Systems): Experience with specific HRIS platforms like Workday, BambooHR, ADP, Namely, etc., is crucial. Mentioning specific systems you use is a good idea.

Data Manipulation & Cleaning: Skills in Excel (pivot tables, vlookups, macros), SQL, or other data manipulation tools are essential for handling HR data.

Statistical Analysis: Understanding basic statistical concepts (mean, median, mode, standard deviation) and how to apply them to HR data is important for drawing meaningful conclusions.

Data Visualization: Creating clear and compelling reports and dashboards using tools like Excel, PowerPoint, or dedicated visualization software (Tableau, Power BI) is vital for communicating insights.

Metrics & KPIs: Knowledge of key HR metrics (turnover rate, time-to-hire, employee engagement scores, etc.) and how to track and analyze them.

HR Domain Knowledge:  A good trainer should have a solid understanding of HR principles and practices, including:

Talent Acquisition: Metrics related to recruitment, sourcing, and onboarding.

Compensation & Benefits: Analyzing salary data, benefits costs, and compensation trends.

Performance Management: Understanding performance review processes and metrics.

Employee Relations: Analyzing employee feedback and identifying trends.

HR Compliance: Familiarity with relevant labor laws and regulations (e.g., GDPR, EEOC).

Problem-Solving & Critical Thinking:  HR Analysts need to be able to:

Identify trends and patterns: Analyze data to uncover insights and potential issues.

Develop solutions: Propose data-driven recommendations to address HR challenges.

Evaluate the effectiveness of HR programs: Measure the impact of HR initiatives and make
adjustments as needed.

Communication & Presentation Skills:  Being able to communicate complex data clearly and concisely is essential. Look for trainers who can help develop:

Written communication: Creating reports, presentations, and other HR documents.

Verbal communication: Presenting findings to stakeholders and explaining complex data in a simple way.

Additional Skills (Beneficial but not always required for entry-level):

Project Management: Managing HR projects and initiatives.

Change Management: Supporting organizational change efforts.

Business Acumen: Understanding how HR metrics impact the overall business strategy.
When posting on Upwork, be specific!

Target Audience: "I need a trainer for an entry-level HR Analyst." or "I need a trainer for experienced HR professionals transitioning to an analytics focus."

Specific Tools: "My team uses Workday and Excel extensively. Experience with these is a must."

Learning Objectives: "I want the training to focus on data visualization and reporting
techniques." or "I need help understanding HR metrics and KPIs."

Training Format: "I prefer online, one-on-one training." or "Group training for my HR team."
skills: ['Miro', 'Qualitative Research', 'Training', 'HR & Business Services', 'ISO 14001', 'Communications']

title: Monday.com Project Manager for Marketing Agency
description:
We don‚Äôt hire good‚Äîwe hire the best. If you‚Äôre ready to deliver exceptional results and thrive in a high-performance environment, read on.

About ScalingFinTech

At ScalingFinTech, we don‚Äôt settle for ordinary. We‚Äôre on a mission to build the world‚Äôs most trusted, innovative agency network, delivering exceptional client experiences and data-driven results that help FinTech companies dominate globally.

We‚Äôre redefining how FinTech brands grow by combining cutting-edge AI strategies with a relentless commitment to excellence. Every member of our team is a superstar, and we‚Äôre searching for a Project Manager who‚Äôs ready to raise the bar even higher.

This role isn‚Äôt just about managing projects‚Äîit‚Äôs about owning the entire client journey and delivering measurable success at every touchpoint. If you thrive under pressure, love wearing multiple hats, and are ready to make a lasting impact, this is your opportunity to join a team of elite professionals shaping the future of FinTech.

About the Role

As our Project Manager, you‚Äôll be at the heart of every client‚Äôs journey‚Äîensuring seamless onboarding, flawless execution, proactive support, insightful reporting, and long-term retention. You‚Äôll take ownership of the most critical processes that define the client experience and directly contribute to their success and our growth.

In this role, you‚Äôll need to be agile, resourceful, and exceptionally organized, as you‚Äôll oversee multiple responsibilities simultaneously. As we scale, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to specialize in an area of your expertise, but for now, you‚Äôll be the go-to leader for driving excellence across the board.

What You‚Äôll Do

- Client Onboarding: Lead the onboarding process for new clients, ensuring alignment, clarity, and confidence from day one.

- Project Management: Oversee project execution, manage timelines, and ensure deliverables exceed expectations.

- Client Success: Act as the primary point of contact, addressing client needs, resolving issues, and fostering strong relationships.

- Reporting & Optimization: Oversee the delivery of actionable reports, helping clients see the measurable value of our services and identifying areas for improvement.

- Retention Strategies: Develop and implement strategies to ensure clients remain satisfied, engaged, and long-term partners.

Why ScalingFinTech?

- Be Part of Something Extraordinary: Work with elite professionals delivering transformative results for FinTech‚Äôs fastest-growing companies.

- Limitless Growth Opportunities: Take on a multi-faceted role now, and as we scale, grow into a specialized leadership position.

- Innovation at Your Fingertips: Use cutting-edge tools, AI strategies, and data-driven solutions to achieve unparalleled results.

- Global Impact: Help FinTech companies expand internationally, making your work truly meaningful.
A Culture of Excellence: Join a team that‚Äôs as committed to your success as you are to delivering results.

What Makes You a Superstar?

We‚Äôre not just looking for someone good‚Äîwe want someone extraordinary. You‚Äôll excel in this role if you:

- Own Organization: You thrive on juggling multiple projects and still maintain flawless attention to detail.

- Build Client Relationships Like No Other: You‚Äôre a natural communicator who knows how to earn trust and exceed expectations.

- Deliver Results That Matter: You prioritize measurable outcomes and always find ways to go above and beyond.

- Love Challenges: You embrace high-pressure situations with calm and resourcefulness.

- Think Like an Analyst: You use data to inform decisions and uncover opportunities for optimization.

- Collaborate Effortlessly: You know how to align cross-functional teams and deliver results as a cohesive unit.

- Hunger for Growth: You‚Äôre excited to take on a broad role now and grow into a specialized leadership position as we scale.

Qualifications

- Proven Experience: 3+ years in project management, client success, or operations, ideally in an agency or high-growth environment.

- Tech-Savvy: Proficiency in project management platforms (e.g., Monday.com, Asana) and reporting tools (e.g., Tableau, Excel).

- Client-Facing Expertise: Experience managing client relationships and delivering outstanding service.

- Analytical Mindset: Strong ability to interpret data and present actionable insights.

- Startup Ready: Comfortable thriving in a fast-paced, evolving environment with competing priorities.

- Bonus: Experience in FinTech or regulated industries is a plus.

What Success Looks Like

- Clients onboard smoothly and achieve quick wins, building trust and momentum.
- Projects are completed on time, exceeding quality expectations and client goals.

title: Guide Creation for Opening Group Homes and Assisted Living Facilities
description:
Job Title: Research Analyst for Assisted Living Facility and Group Home Start up

---

Job Overview:  
We are seeking a detail-oriented and dedicated Research Analyst to help lay the groundwork for the successful establishment of an Assisted Living Facility and a Group Home. This role involves comprehensive research into state requirements, cost analysis, and strategic planning to ensure a profitable and compliant business launch. The ideal candidate will provide in-depth insights into industry regulations, pricing strategies, and operational requirements, clearly distinguishing the differences between Assisted Living Facilities and Group Homes.  



Key Responsibilities:

1. Industry Research and Analysis:
   - Conduct detailed research on **state-specific requirements** for licensing, staffing, safety, and operational guidelines for both Assisted Living Facilities and Group Homes.  
   - Investigate local zoning laws**, building codes, and community regulations to identify suitable locations.  
   - Analyze market trends and demand for Assisted Living and Group Homes in the targeted area.  

2. Financial Analysis and Pricing Strategy:  
   - Determine the monthly rate to charge residents by analyzing competitors, cost of living, and state reimbursement rates.  
   - Calculate operational costs, including staffing, utilities, food, medical supplies, and maintenance.  
   - Establish a profitability model considering state funding programs, private pay, and insurance reimbursements.  

3. Compliance and Legal Requirements:  
   - Identify all necessary licensing and permits required by the state and local authorities.  
   - Understand insurance requirements and liability coverage essential for operating the facilities.  
   - Research healthcare regulations and compliance standards, including medication management, emergency protocols, and resident rights.  

4. Service Differentiation and Facility Planning:  
   - Clearly explain the difference between Assisted Living Facilities and Group Homes including the type of care provided, staffing requirements, and target demographics.  
   - Provide recommendations on facility layout, room configurations, safety features, and accessibility standards.  

5. Operational Strategy and Staffing Requirements:  
   - Outline staffing needs, including administrators, caregivers, medical personnel, cooks, and maintenance staff.  
   - Research state-mandated staff-to-resident ratios and necessary staff certifications.  
   - Develop a detailed **organizational chart** to define roles and responsibilities.  

6. **Marketing and Community Integration:**  
   - Develop a marketing strategy to attract residents, highlighting key features and differentiators.  
   - Investigate community programs, healthcare partnerships, and referral networks to establish credibility.  

7.Reporting and Documentation:
   - Compile findings into comprehensive reports with actionable recommendations.  
   - Create a step-by-step roadmap for the successful launch and operation of both facilities.  



Qualifications:
-  Healthcare Management, Public Administration, or related field.  
- **Proven experience** in market research, business planning, or healthcare industry analysis.  
- Strong knowledge of state regulations and compliance requirements in the assisted living and group home sectors**.  
- Excellent analytical and organizational skills with attention to detail.  
- Proficient in financial modeling, cost analysis, and strategic planning.  
- Exceptional communication and report-writing abilities.  

---

Key Competencies:  
- Attention to Detail: Ensures accuracy in research, compliance, and reporting.  
-Analytical Thinking: Ability to interpret data and make strategic decisions.  
- **Communication Skills:** Clearly explains complex regulations and financial information.  
- **Problem-Solving:** Identifies challenges and provides effective solutions.  



Application Process:
To apply, please submit your resume, cover letter, and a sample of previous research work related to healthcare, assisted living, or group home industries.  



Note:  
This job description is crafted to provide comprehensive research and strategic planning necessary for the successful establishment of an Assisted Living Facility and Group Home, ensuring all legal, financial, and operational requirements are met.

title: Data Analytics and Dashboard Specialist to set up a multi-channel performance tracking dashboard
description:
We are a UK-based Digital Marketing Agency and are seeking a data analytics and dashboard specialist to set up a multi-channel performance tracking dashboard for our B2B marketing campaigns. The dashboard should integrate data from various marketing platforms, ad networks, outreach tools, and website analytics to provide a single source of truth for evaluating campaign performance.

The goal is to consolidate data from LinkedIn, Facebook, Google Ads, Email Outreach (Instantly.ai), Email Retargeting (MailerLite), and LinkedIn Outreach (Skylead) into a real-time, automated dashboard using Databox or an equivalent platform.

Project Objectives:
‚Ä¢ Integrate data from all relevant marketing channels (LinkedIn Ads, Facebook Ads, Google Ads, Email, Outreach, and GA4)
‚Ä¢ Automate data flow for tracking impressions, CTR, website visits, and conversion rates
‚Ä¢ Implement UTM tracking across all sources to accurately measure attribution
‚Ä¢ Create a dashboard that provides real-time visibility into marketing performance
‚Ä¢ Enable filtering by channel, campaign, and conversion event
‚Ä¢ Ensure scalability for tracking client campaigns in the future

Required Integrations:
The dashboard should include the following data sources:

1Ô∏è. Social & Paid Ads Performance Tracking
‚úÖ LinkedIn Organic & Ads (CTR, Link Clicks, Website Visits)
‚úÖ Facebook Organic & Ads (CTR, Link Clicks, Website Visits)
‚úÖ Google Ads (CTR, Website Visits, Landing Page Performance)

2Ô∏è. Email & Outreach Tracking
‚úÖ Email Outreach (Instantly.ai) (Sent, Open Rate, Replies, Call Bookings, CTR to Website)
‚úÖ Email Retargeting (MailerLite) (Sent, Open Rate, CTR to Website, Conversion Rate)
‚úÖ LinkedIn Outreach (Skylead) (Connection Requests, Reply Rates, Call Bookings, CTR to Website)

3Ô∏è. Website & Lead Tracking (Google Analytics 4)
‚úÖ UTM tracking for all campaigns (Source, Medium, Campaign)
‚úÖ Website Visits from each channel
‚úÖ Landing Page Conversion Rate (Lead Magnet Downloads √∑ Visitors)

Key Metrics to Track:
                                
Facebook Organic Posts
LinkedIn Organic Posts
LinkedIn Ads
Facebook Ads
Google Ads
Email Outreach (Instantly.ai)
Email Retargeting (MailerLite)
LinkedIn Outreach (Skylead)

Scope of Work:

Phase 1: Data Integration & UTM Setup
‚Ä¢ Ensure all campaign links have UTM tracking
‚Ä¢ Integrate Google Analytics 4 to track website visits & conversions
‚Ä¢ Connect LinkedIn, Facebook, and Google Ads to Databox (or another dashboard tool)
‚Ä¢ Integrate Instantly.ai, MailerLite, and Skylead for email & outreach tracking

Phase 2: Dashboard Creation & Automation
‚Ä¢ Build a real-time dashboard that consolidates all marketing data
‚Ä¢ Design filters & visualizations for easy tracking (e.g., by channel, campaign, and conversion type)
‚Ä¢ Set up automated reports & alerts for key performance indicators (KPIs)

Phase 3: Testing & Optimization
‚Ä¢ Verify data accuracy across all platforms
‚Ä¢ Optimize dashboard for usability & insights
‚Ä¢ Provide documentation or training session on how to use the dashboard

Ideal Candidate:
We are looking for an experienced data analyst, BI specialist, or marketing analytics expert with:
‚úÖ Proven experience setting up Databox, Google Data Studio, or similar dashboards
‚úÖ Strong knowledge of Google Analytics 4, UTM tracking, and campaign attribution
‚úÖ Experience integrating LinkedIn Ads, Facebook Ads, Google Ads, and email platforms
‚úÖ Ability to automate data pipelines & reporting
‚úÖ Excellent communication & willingness to support ongoing client projects

Project Timeline & Budget:
‚Ä¢ Required completion time: 1-2 weeks
‚Ä¢ Budget: Open to proposals based on experience & scope

How to Apply:
Please provide the following when applying:
1. Examples of similar dashboards you have built (Databox, GA4, or other tools)
2. Your experience with marketing analytics & automation
3. Your availability & estimated timeline for completion
4. Your rate for this project + potential ongoing support costs

Future Work Potential:
This is a long-term opportunity for the right freelancer. If this project is successful, we will require ongoing support for tracking & reporting client campaigns, setting up dashboards for clients, and optimizing marketing performance.

We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Guide me on a call to build a Make.com Sales Meeting Research Automation Project
description:
*Guide me on a call to build a make.com automation*

Looking for a Make.com expert to guide me on a call to build an automation that:
1. Monitors my Google Calendar for upcoming sales meetings
2. 24 hours before each meeting, automatically researches the prospect and their company
3. Creates a detailed research brief following our template
4. Delivers it via email/Google Doc

Important: I want to build this myself with your guidance during screen-sharing sessions. This is not a project for someone to build independently.

Why This Matters
I sell sales technology software. Before every meeting, I need to understand:
- The prospect's sales organization and processes
- Their current challenges and growth plans
- The leader's background and likely priorities
- Areas where our solution could help them


What We Have Ready
1. Accounts & Access:
   - Make.com account
   - Google Workspace (Calendar + Gmail)
   - Claude API access
   - Google Drive for storage
   - Research brief template

2. Data Requirements:
   - Know exactly what data points we need
   - Have example of ideal output
   - Clear about public data sources
   - Template for final brief

Core Technical Requirements

1. Calendar Integration
Must:
- Monitor Google Calendar for new meetings
- Identify external vs internal meetings
- Extract attendee details
- Trigger process 24h before meeting

2. Data Gathering
Need to collect:
- Company information
- Leader's background
- Sales team structure
- Recent company changes
From public sources like:
- Company websites
- LinkedIn public pages
- Job boards
- News sites

3. Analysis & Processing
Using Claude API to:
- Analyze gathered data
- Identify patterns
- Generate insights
- Structure information

4. Output Generation
Create:
- Structured research brief
- Source citations
- Confidence levels
- Delivery via email/docs

Implementation Process

Working Format
- Screen sharing session
- You guide, I implement
- Focus on understanding

What I Need From You

Required Experience
- Advanced Make.com scenarios
- API integrations
- Data processing
- Error handling
- Teaching/guidance skills

Your Proposal Should Include
1. Your Experience:
   - Similar projects
   - Make.com expertise
   - Teaching approach

2. Technical Plan:
   - Implementation approach
   - Potential challenges
   - Solution architecture

3. Practical Details:
   - Time estimate
   - Cost estimate
   - Availability

Example Output
To understand the depth of research needed, here's an example of what a good brief looks like:

---

Company & Leader Analysis: TechGrowth Solutions
Meeting with: Alex Rivera, Director of Sales Operations

Alex's Journey & Context

Career Progression (All dates/titles from LinkedIn):

1. StartupCo - Sales Ops Analyst (1.5 years)

   - First sales ops role
   - Company had ~50 employees at the time

   - Likely focused on foundational systems and reporting
   - Probably worked with small sales team (10-15 sellers)

2. Enterprise Tech Co - Sales Systems Admin (2 years)
   [FACT - LinkedIn]:
   - Technical sales ops role
   - Worked in enterprise software company
   - Company had 500+ employees
   
   [INFERRED from role & company type]:
   - Focus on sales tech stack and integrations
   - Exposure to enterprise sales processes

3. FastGrowth SaaS - Sales Ops Manager (2.5 years)
   [FACT - LinkedIn + Company Press]:
   - First management role
   - Company raised Series C during their tenure
   - Company grew from 100 to 300 employees
   
   [FACT - Their LinkedIn Posts]:
   - Led ops during major team expansion
   - Built new territory models
   
   [INFERRED from company stage]:
   - Handled comp plan development
   - Built scalable processes

4. TechGrowth - Director of Sales Ops (11 months)
   [FACT - LinkedIn + Job Posts]:
   - First director-level role
   - Currently hiring ops team members
   - Company in post-Series B phase
   
   [FACT - Their LinkedIn Activity]:
   - Posts about scaling operations
   - Engaging with content about sales tech
   
   [INFERRED from role + company stage]:
   - Leading strategic ops initiatives
   - Building out ops function

Role Context & Implications

Current Position Deep-Dive
[FACT - LinkedIn]:
- Director of Sales Ops at Series B enterprise software company
- 11 months in role
- First ops leadership hire at this company

Organizational Context
[INFERRED from Role + Stage]:

- Building ops function from ground up

Key Metrics & Pressures

  * Sales productivity metrics

[INFERRED from Series B + Enterprise]:

Daily Reality

title: Cost Analysis
description:
I am looking for:

Cost-Savings Analysis
1. A cost-savings analysis showing how much my product saves people money by replacing in-home products. (Product list will be provided but much research needs to be done) Please include a spreadsheet showing how the data was calculated, where it came from, and how it was determined, such as, average use per person per day per product, etc. Focus solely on using product prices from Amazon.com. Environmental Footprint Analysis
1. Analysis demonstrating the amount of plastic saved by individuals who invest in my machine who replace in-home products (Same list of products as above).
2. Analysis demonstrating the amount of plastic saved by individuals who invest in my machine who used to drink out of plastic water bottles and now do not.
3. Combined environmental stewardship analysis

Presentation of the data for customers as:
a) An easy to understand 1-pager guide (spreadsheet format) for my customers to understand the products this machine replaces and average monthly savings for a family of 4 (Mother, Father, Sister, Brother) so essentially some products are only going to be used by the Mother and Sister like make up remover, etc. using lower to middle class products (purchased from Walmart, Amazon, CVS, Rite Aid in the analysis to be as realistic as possible)
b) If possible, I would like a 1 pager visual demonstrating the environmental footprint saved by my device but if design is not in your wheelhouse, I'm more interested in the data analysis side of things for this project!

Resources must be branded my brand colors and themes, etc. and must be editable for future changes.

The goal is to show that my product is a "no-brainer" for people to purchase, just with the savings alone! Not to mention all the health benefits.

title: Real Estate Investment Deal Analyst
description:
Job Title: Deal Analyst

Role Overview:
The Deal Analyst will be responsible for conducting comprehensive deal evaluations and due diligence to support investment decision-making. This role involves analyzing market conditions, assessing financial and legal documents, and synthesizing key deal insights. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical mindset, attention to detail, and the ability to work collaboratively within a team of fund managers and legal professionals.

Key Responsibilities:

Deal Evaluation & Analysis:

Conduct in-depth market analysis for potential investments, including demographics, economic indicators, and competitive landscape.

Assess business plans, financial statements, and underwriting assumptions to validate deal projections.

Review and verify key financing terms, ensuring alignment between term sheets and deal expectations.

Due Diligence & Risk Assessment:

Perform holistic due diligence across multiple deal types, including self-storage, mobile home parks, multifamily apartments, medical office buildings, and business acquisitions.

Identify potential risks, inconsistencies, or red flags in deal structures and investment proposals.

Maintain a shared due diligence spreadsheet, updating insights and findings for fund managers.

Collaboration & Communication:

Work closely with fund managers to provide thorough deal assessments and support investment decisions.

Liaise with legal professionals (including paralegals) to ensure legal documents, such as PPMs and subscription agreements, reflect intended deal terms.

Participate in weekly deal review meetings, presenting findings and discussing investment viability.

Process Optimization & Reporting:

Develop structured reports summarizing deal strengths, weaknesses, and overall investment viability.

Manage the inputs for deal analytics models, ensuring accurate financial projections and investor return calculations.

Continuously refine due diligence processes to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.

Expectations & Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in finance, real estate, economics, or a related field (preferred but not required).

Experience in real estate investment analysis, private equity, or fund management is highly desirable.

Strong proficiency in financial modeling, Excel, and data interpretation.

Ability to analyze and interpret market data, business plans, and financial agreements.

Excellent organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple deals simultaneously.

Strong communication skills to convey deal insights to fund managers and legal teams.

Detail-oriented mindset with a proactive approach to problem-solving.

Comfortable working in a dynamic, fast-paced investment environment.

Time Commitment & Compensation:

Estimated workload of 5-15 hours per deal, depending on deal complexity and due diligence requirements.

Compensation structure to be determined based on deal volume and analyst experience.

Flexibility to scale workload based on fund activity and deal flow.

This role presents a unique opportunity to work closely with experienced fund managers, gain exposure to diverse investment opportunities, and refine deal analysis expertise in a hands-on, collaborative setting. If you are detail-oriented, analytical, and passionate about real estate and investment analysis, we encourage you to apply.
skills: ['Financial Modeling', 'Microsoft Excel', 'Cryptocurrency', 'Business Analysis', 'Content Writing', 'Financial Analysis', 'Blockchain']

title: Experienced Real Estate Analyst Needed ‚Äì Florida Market Report for Real Estate Investment Fund
description:
I am looking to hire a highly skilled real estate analyst to conduct a comprehensive market study of the Florida real estate market, comparing data from 18 months ago to the present. This report will be used to raise capital for a real estate investment fund, so it must be detailed, investor-focused, and data-driven.

The report should provide a deep analysis of market trends across all property types, including residential, commercial, multifamily, distressed properties, foreclosures, tax deeds, and reverse mortgages. The goal is to identify key indicators of a market shift, highlighting emerging investment opportunities and providing actionable insights for potential investors.

The right candidate must have direct access to reliable real estate data sources and be able to deliver a high-quality, research-backed investment report that will appeal to high-net-worth individuals, institutional investors, and private capital firms.

Key Data Points for the Report (Investor-Focused)
1. Market Trends & Performance Analysis
Active Listings ‚Äì Inventory growth over the past 18 months
Months of Inventory (Absorption Rate) ‚Äì Identifying when the market flips from a seller‚Äôs market to a buyer‚Äôs market
Sales Volume & Home Price Trends ‚Äì Median sale prices, high/low ranges, and fluctuations over time
Days on Market (DOM) ‚Äì Measuring how long properties take to sell
2. Investment Opportunity Indicators
Price Reductions & Seller Concessions ‚Äì Indications of a softening market
Foreclosures & Tax Deed Sales ‚Äì Volume of distressed sales and tax-delinquent properties available for investors
Institutional & Hedge Fund Activity ‚Äì Tracking large investor movements in Florida real estate
Cash vs. Financed Purchases ‚Äì Understanding investor vs. end-user participation in the market
3. Mortgage & Distressed Property Trends
Reverse Mortgage Defaults ‚Äì Identifying financial distress among older homeowners
Foreclosure Filings & Bank-Owned (REO) Sales ‚Äì Monitoring distressed assets for investor acquisitions
Mortgage Delinquencies & Loan Modifications ‚Äì Early warning signs of financial strain in the market
4. Market Analysis by Property Type
Residential (Single-Family, Condos, Townhomes) ‚Äì Market trends, price movements, and inventory shifts
Commercial Real Estate (Office, Retail, Industrial, Mixed-Use) ‚Äì Evaluating the impact of remote work and business shifts
Multifamily Properties (2-4 Units & Large Apartment Complexes) ‚Äì Rental market trends, cap rates, and occupancy rates
Vacant Land & New Construction ‚Äì Developer activity and new building permits
Distressed & Tax Deed Properties ‚Äì Volume, availability, and investor demand for undervalued assets
5. Florida-Specific Investment Considerations
Tax Deed Auctions & Property Liens ‚Äì Opportunities in distressed tax-delinquent properties
Property Insurance Crisis ‚Äì Rising costs and the impact on market affordability
Zoning & Policy Changes ‚Äì Local and state legislative changes affecting real estate investments
Economic Indicators ‚Äì Unemployment, wage growth, and migration trends driving demand
Ideal Candidate:
‚úÖ Experienced real estate analyst with access to MLS, CoreLogic, ATTOM, county tax deed auction data, and foreclosure records
‚úÖ Background in real estate investment research, market forecasting, and financial modeling
‚úÖ Ability to create a high-quality, investor-focused report with compelling data visualization (charts, graphs, tables)
‚úÖ Must cite all data sources and provide transparent methodology
‚úÖ Understanding of foreclosure, tax deed, and distressed asset investing in Florida

Project Scope & Deadline:
Completed report due by February 19th
Deliver a professional, investor-ready report (formatted for presentations and fundraising)
Include detailed insights, forecasts, and risk assessments
Provide clear, actionable investment strategies based on the data
Why This Report Matters:
I believe Florida‚Äôs real estate market is undergoing a rapid transition to a buyer‚Äôs market, creating unique opportunities for investors. With increasing inventory, longer days on the market, and rising distressed asset availability, now is the time to position a real estate fund for acquisitions.

This report will be a key tool in raising capital from investors who want to take advantage of market shifts. It must clearly outline the risks and opportunities while providing concrete data to support investment decisions.

If you have the experience, data access, and analytical expertise to produce a high-quality real estate investment report, I‚Äôd love to work with you!

Please include samples of previous investor-focused real estate reports when applying.

title: Web Analyst for Startup Project
description:
About Elly Analytics:

Our mission is to make advanced full-funnel analytics accessible and affordable for businesses that can't hire a data analytics team.
The company was founded in 2019 by experts in performance marketing with over a decade of experience. For the last two years, we've been focusing on the US market and have achieved great results.
We've secured a $1 million investment and continue to grow, doubling our size every year. This growth is driven by effective sales channels and strong [client testimonials](https://ellyanalytics.com/case-studies) from the US, showcasing the high quality of our product.
As we keep expanding, we‚Äôre always on the lookout for new team members. You can check out our current job openings below.

We are a fully remote company with team members from different countries. Our workflow is flexible, focusing on the results and efforts you put in, rather than controlling your time.
Elly prides itself on having a very open culture. You can freely speak up and be heard by the founders, ask questions, and receive honest answers.
Join the Elly team to grow together in the US market ‚Äî the biggest, most challenging, and most competitive market in the world.

What you'll need to do:

As a web analyst, you will be part of our Product team and will

- Provide Expert Support for Ongoing Projects:
    - You will be responsible for diagnosing and fixing web analytics issues, particularly those related to Google Analytics and advertising platforms conversion tracking.
    - As a subject matter expert, you may participate in client meetings to offer insights and solutions for web analytics setups.
    - You'll take ownership of the quality and consistency of web analytics data across our entire project portfolio.
- Contribute to Product Development:
    - As a part of our product team, you will use your knowledge and insights from projects to ensure our product evolves to proactively prevent these issues in the future.
- Strengthen the expertise of the Product team by sharing your knowledge and mentoring team members

Requirements:

We're seeking a candidate who meets the following requirements:
‚Äî  3+ years in web analytics with a strong portfolio of custom conversion setups.
‚Äî  Expertise in Google Analytics 4 and tracking online/offline conversions.
‚Äî  Experience configuring advertising platform conversions.
‚Äî Possesses upper-intermediate or advanced English language skills and native level of Russian.


Please note that you must be available five days a week and have at least five working hours overlap with the team and clients (PST/PDT time zone).


Perks and Benefits:

‚Äî Professional growth: Opportunity to grow to Team Lead level and lead own team;
‚Äî Work remotely: Live and work wherever you like!
‚Äî Employment: via Deel contract.


Hiring Process:

Do you fit this role and want to join our team?
These are the following steps:

1. Apply for a job ‚Üí

2. Complete a short survey about your experience ‚Üí

3. Meet our team at the 1st interview ‚Üí

4. Meet with our team lead of analysts ‚Üí

5. Review results with our co-founder ‚Üí

Be hired and join us!

We value time, so the process takes up to two weeks, and our test assignments are paid regardless of the results.

title: Data Analyst for Market Research in Consultancy
description:
We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst with a strong background in market research to support our consultancy projects in the UK and US. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of data analysis techniques, be IT savvy, and possess strong business acumen. Your role will involve gathering and interpreting data, generating insights, and contributing to strategic recommendations. If you are analytical, detail-oriented, and capable of working in a fast-paced environment, we would love to hear from you!
=================================================================
Job Specification: Data Analyst / Market Researcher ‚Äì UK to US Market Expansion
Position: Data Analyst / Market Researcher
Location: Remote / Hybrid (UK-based)
Employment Type: Full-Time
Salary: Competitive, Based on Experience
Company: IB ‚Äì Market Expansion Consultancy

About the Role
IB is a consultancy dedicated to helping UK manufacturers expand into the US market. We are seeking a Data Analyst / Researcher with a strong analytical mindset to conduct in-depth market analysis, providing critical insights that will drive strategic decision-making for our clients. This role requires a detail-oriented professional with experience in data analysis, market research, and business intelligence.

Key Responsibilities
Conduct thorough market viability studies for UK manufacturers entering the US market.
Utilize various data sources to analyze industry trends, consumer demand, competition, and pricing strategies.
Research regulatory requirements, import/export tariffs, and distribution channels in the US.
Compile findings into clear, concise, and actionable reports with properly cited sources.
Use Excel and data visualization tools to present complex datasets in an understandable manner.
Collaborate with business consultants to provide market entry recommendations based on data insights.
Monitor and track key economic indicators and changes in consumer behavior.
Ensure data accuracy, reliability, and relevance to guide client business decisions.
Essential Qualifications & Experience
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Economics, Business Analytics, Data Science, or a related field.
Experience in market research and data analysis (minimum 2-3 years preferred).
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, and Email communication tools.
Ability to research accurate, relevant, and up-to-date sources and correctly cite them.
Exceptional analytical skills with the ability to interpret and distill large datasets into meaningful insights.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a clear and concise approach.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience working with UK-based businesses or international market expansion projects.
Familiarity with US market regulations, tariffs, and distribution models.
A strong sense of curiosity and problem-solving ability to navigate complex business landscapes.
Equal Opportunity Statement
IB is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. We welcome applications from candidates of all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. All hiring decisions are based on qualifications, merit, and business needs.

Why Join Us?
Work with innovative UK manufacturers looking to expand globally.
Opportunity to have a direct impact on major business decisions.
Flexible working arrangements with potential for remote/hybrid work.
A dynamic and growing company focused on international trade and commerce.
If you are a data-driven professional looking for an exciting challenge in international market research, apply today!

title: Real Estate Data Analyst ‚Äì Property Comps Specialist
description:
APPLICANTS MUST READ THE FULL POSTING AND FOLLOW THE TWO-STEP APPLICATION PROCEDURE. ANY INCOMPLETE APPLICATIONS WILL BE EXCLUDED.

Are you detail-oriented, analytical, and passionate about real estate data? Do you have a keen eye for property valuations and enjoy deep-diving into numbers to identify profitable opportunities? If so, we‚Äôre looking for you!

Who We Are
Lightning Capital House Buyers is a successful and growing real estate company seeking standout Property Comps Specialist to join our hardworking and dynamic team. We are looking for a skilled Real Estate Data Analyst to help us make accurate and informed decisions.

CORE VALUES
We‚Äôre looking for a tenacious person who wants to serve and add value to the growth of our company while bettering their own life! Someone who lives out our core values ‚Äì Integrity: WE ALWAYS DO THE RIGHT THING, Positive "can do" Attitude, Strives to Exceeds Expectations in Everything We Do, Team Player (Always willing to step in and help out), Results Over Excuses.

Who You Are
You‚Äôre not just someone who looks at numbers‚Äîyou interpret them. You thrive on structure, precision, and uncovering insights that others might miss. Your behavioral strengths align with those of an Artisan, Specialist, or Scholar:

‚úÖ Artisan ‚Äì You have a keen eye for detail, love perfecting your craft, and enjoy refining your methods to deliver accurate property valuations.
‚úÖ Specialist ‚Äì You‚Äôre methodical, process-driven, and take pride in doing things the right way every time. You value expertise and precision in your work.
‚úÖ Scholar ‚Äì You love research, deep analysis, and using data to make well-informed decisions. You seek patterns, trends, and logic to guide your conclusions.

Your Key Responsibilities
Comping Properties: Analyze real estate market data to determine accurate property values based on comparable sales.
Data Research & Entry: Pull and organize property data from MLS, PropStream, Zillow, and other platforms.
Market Analysis: Identify trends, potential deals, and ARVs (After Repair Values) to help our acquisitions team make data-backed decisions.
Reporting: Provide clear and concise property analysis reports that guide purchasing decisions.

What You Bring to the Table
Experience comping properties using MLS, Zillow, PropStream, BatchLeads, or similar tools.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a high level of accuracy in data interpretation.
Ability to work efficiently and meet deadlines in a fast-moving real estate environment.
Familiarity with real estate wholesaling, fix & flip, or buy-and-hold investment strategies is a plus.
Reliable internet connection and ability to work 10 AM ‚Äì 7 PM EST.

Location: Remote
Work Schedule: Monday-Friday 10 AM ‚Äì 7 PM EST
Pay: $3 - $6 per hour

APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS - 2-STEP PROCESS (ALL APPLICATIONS WILL BE DISCARDED THAT HAVE NOT COMPLETED THESE 2 STEPS)

1. PLEASE SEND AN EMAIL TO ARLYN, THE OPERATIONS ASSISTANT AT OPERATION(at)LCHOUSEBUYERS(dot)COM WITH A SUBJECT LINE: APPLICATION FOR EXPERIENCED PROPERTY COMPS SPECIALIST -UW

ANSWER THESE QUESTIONS:
Please tell us about your property comp experience and the tools/software used in comping.
What are you looking for in your next position?
What interests you about this specific role and our company?

2. PLEASE INCLUDE A PDF COPY OF YOUR UPDATED RESUME IN YOUR EMAIL.

**NOTE: This process allows the cream to rise to the top and lets us know that you pay attention to detail and can follow instructions**

Thank You!

and company reporting. The ideal candidate will have experience in SaaS financial metrics, revenue modeling, and company financial planning, as well as proficiency in modern
presentation tools to create engaging reports for stakeholders

Perusall began following a major four-year research project at Harvard University; we created the platform to serve students in our classes, and then in 2015 built the business to bring our research to students and instructors everywhere. Perusall is now a profitable business that has served more than 4 million students, 95,000 instructors, at 6,000 educational institutions, in 117 countries.

title: Financial Data Collection (from standard Databases)
description:
I am hiring a freelancer to collect a set of additional variables to match with an existing database.

The existing database (attached) is a Mergers and Acquisitions Announcement database from US public firms with 654 observations.

It has seven variables:
- "AcquirorNameEikon": The name of the acquirer firm (as presented on the Eikon database.
- "ticker": the stock symbol used to identify the firm (in this case, the acquirer);
- "cusip8_comp": an 8-digit code extracted from Compustat that uniquely identifies the firm (in this case, the Acquirer).
- "event_date": the date when the Merger or Acquisition was announced;
- "TranscriptFile": a file name of the corresponding announcement transcript (not important for this study).
- "PrivateTarget": a variable which takes the value 1 if the acquired firm (or Target) is Private and 0 if the acquired firm (or Target) is Public

The variables I need to collect for each observation/event are the following:
- Acquisition premium (only for the events in which the Target is Public (i.e., when PrivateTarget=0)
- Overall number of Mergers and Acquisitions in the US in the quarter of the announcement date (as specified in "event_date")
- Total number of board members of the Acquirer
- Total number of independent board members of the Acquirer
- Binary variable taking the value of 1 if the CEO is also the Chairman of the Board and 0 otherwise)
- Analyst coverage (i.e., count of sell-side analysts issuing earnings forecasts or recommendations for a firm)
- Analyst recommendations (i.e., number of 1 (Strong Buy), ..., and 5 (Strong Sell) from all analysts).

The freelancer will have to find a suitable database from which to extract the required variables (some possible options could be Eikon, SDC, Compustat, etc.) and explain the collection process. For each variable, a column should be added to the attached file with the values for that variable.

This job is to be finished by February 23.

Job Title: Amazon Promo Deals & Storage Cost Optimization Specialist

Job Description:
We are in urgent need of an experienced and highly skilled Amazon Promo Deals & Storage Cost Optimization Specialist to help minimize long-term storage fees, optimize inventory, and implement effective promotional strategies for slow-moving products. This role is critical to our company's profitability as we transition to a lean, cost-effective inventory strategy that aligns with our business goals.

Key Responsibilities:
Analyze and optimize Amazon storage strategy to minimize long-term storage fees and prevent overspending on inventory holding costs.
Conduct in-depth assessments of our current Amazon inventory logistics, storage, and fee structures to identify inefficiencies and areas for improvement.
Develop actionable strategies to prevent overshipping and overstocking in expensive Amazon warehouses.
Identify slow-moving products and implement promotional deals, such as Lightning Deals, Coupons, and Discount Strategies, to improve sales velocity and reduce storage costs.
Advise the advertising team on running targeted campaigns to sell out slow-moving inventory.
Monitor and forecast inventory needs to balance supply and demand effectively while reducing storage fees.

Qualifications:

Experience in Amazon Seller Central, including running promotional deals and coordinating advertising efforts.
Strong analytical skills to assess data, identify trends, and provide actionable insights.
Excellent organizational and time-management skills to handle multiple tasks efficiently.
Ability to work independently, take full responsibility for cost reduction goals, and achieve measurable results.
Strong communication skills for reporting progress and collaborating with internal teams.
Knowledge of Amazon Seller Central tools and inventory management software is a plus.
What We‚Äôre Looking For:
A results-oriented professional who thrives on solving complex problems and achieving measurable outcomes.
Someone who is proactive, detail-oriented, and capable of taking ownership of this critical role.
An expert who can quickly understand our business model and implement cost-saving and sales-boosting strategies effectively.
Work Arrangement:

title: Data Analyst needed for Excel data analysis and possible website crosswalk (quick turnaround)
description:
Project Requirements & Objective:
Perform data analysis and research and share findings. Use MS Excel, raw data files provided, online resources, and any other tools or resources at contractor's discretion, to identify instances where vendors are delivering similar services to and/or across 2 or more sub-organizations(known as bureaus) within the Department of Commerce(DOC).

The goal is to highlight evidence of such scenarios in a new Excel (.xlsx) output file and provide a summary of findings.

The purpose and business goal of this exercise is to enable the Department of Commerce to avoid duplicative costs via negotiation with vendors for a more competitive rate, or the removal of redundant contracts/services.

Objective Context/Background:

‚Ä¢ If the vendor "Thundercat" is providing AWS brokerage services to MBDA(bureau 1), but providing cyber-security services to EDA(bureau 2) - that's not a significant or value-added analytics finding.........because separate services doesn't present a lot of opportunity for consolidation or cost savings with that one vendor.
‚Ä¢ However, if that one/single vendor is providing the SAME exact product or service across 2 or more bureaus - then that's an analytical finding or outcome we want to document and point to in our discussions with our stakeholders

Tasks:
1. Review all data
2. Perform analysis to identify contract overlap across bureaus/organizations
3. Utilize external/public resources as needed to find out exactly which services/products were offered as part of contract
4. Try to realize the most granular levels of contract detail possible to ensure that 2/more bureaus are using the same exact product or service

Timeline:
1. Prefer to receive first draft of results/findings by end of Sunday (at 9PM EST U.S.)
2. This would allow for any updated iterations/revisions by 12Noon Monday (EST U.S.), based on review of Sunday's findings

Resources/Data:
1. DOC_FPDS_IT_Data_FY24_YTD_11142024 Excel - This file includes DOC data extracted from the PFDS system, and useful data inside this file includes, but is not limited to:
a. "vendors by bureau" tab
b. "FPDS filtered for DOC" tab
i. Column AP
ii. Column CH - "master_piid"
iii. Column CN - "naics_code"
iv. Column CO - "naics_description"
v. Column CS - "piid" - this is a code that often times aligns with the "Award ID" that allows you to research more details about the product/services provided
vi. Column DD - "product_or_service_description"
c. "vendors with most bureaus" tab
d. any other data within the files or via external website(s)
2. FPDS website - https://www.fpds.gov/fpdsng_cms/index.php/en/
3. USA Spending website - https://www.usaspending.gov/
4. Supplemental "DOC_Multi-Bureau_Vendor_Contracts" file

Outputs/Deliverables:
1. New/separate .xlsx with the cross-walked results
2. A combination of a written summary and/or report(s) that reflect the findings of the aggregation. I will leave it up to you to choose the most appropriate method for sharing/summarizing findings.
skills: ['Microsoft Excel', 'Data Analysis', 'IBM SPSS', 'Search Engine Optimization', 'Python', 'Data Science']

title: Senior Recruiter in web3 / crypto space for Technical + Senior roles

### About Chainlabs.ai

Chainlabs is a data startup focused on enabling web3 analytics. We specialize in identifying blockchain address ownership and tracking addresses linked to illicit activities. Our work supports industry leaders like Nansen, Chainalysis, and Arkham in their wallet labeling efforts.

Our primary clients include anti-money laundering (AML) service providers, as well as law enforcement, traders, and academic researchers. Backed by Lunar Rails (200 employees), Chainlabs maintains the agility and independence of a startup while benefiting from financial stability and strong industry connections.

### **About the role**

We're looking for a **Senior Technical Recruiter & HR Specialist** to help us scale our team and hire top talent in the web3 space. This role is critical to our growth and requires someone who understands technical hiring, can manage end-to-end recruitment, and is skilled at evaluating candidates for both technical and leadership positions. title: Web Scraping POC
description:
We are currently scrapping 2500+ websites using Mozenda.  This is a POC (proof of concept) to completely reengineer the process by which this data is scrapped, stored, organized (via a data model), and self served to the consumer of the data (possibly via a BI tool).  

The objectives of the POC (phase 1) are as follows:

- Survey the best of breed and cost effective options for scrapping the data
- Run a POC on 5-10 sites.
- Extrapolate the cost of the process over 2500 websites covering
   - Setup (analyst, etc)
   - Maintenance
   - Recurring Costs (measured on a per website basis, quarterly)
- Options for the ETL of the data into a cloud data lake

The allocated time for this POC is 50 hours.  The target date for completion is end of February.

Once the POC is completed, the results are reviewed and additional phases will be up drawn up as standalone projects.

Tech stack can be a service provider (Octoparse, etc) or it can be a complete custom development on any credible technology.

title: Statistical Consultation ‚Äì Review of Experimental Data Analysis
description:
Job Description:
I am seeking an experienced statistician or data analyst for a one-hour consultation to review the statistical analyses in my experimental study. The study investigates how prosumer vs. non-prosumer service providers impact consumer choices and perceived service quality.

Scope of the Job:
I need expert feedback on the following key aspects of my analysis:

1. Manipulation check: Should we use Chi-square before pairwise comparisons, or is binary logistic regression sufficient?
2. Consumer choice analysis: We used binary logistic regression for choice (between two service providers across three conditions). Would multinomial logistic regression or another approach be more appropriate?
3. Mediation analysis: We used PROCESS Model 4 to examine whether perceived service quality mediates provider type and consumer choice. Is this the correct model for our design?
The study is based on 389 participants from a randomized experiment, and the analysis was conducted in SPSS and PROCESS Macro. More details will be provided upon selection.

Requirements:
. Expertise in SPSS, PROCESS Macro, and logistic regression
. Experience with experimental data analysis and mediation/moderation models
. Ability to provide clear explanations and recommendations
Budget & Duration:
Duration: 1-hour consultation
Budget: Open to proposals based on expertise
Please apply with your relevant experience and availability. Looking forward to your insights!
skills: ['Microsoft Excel', 'Statistics', 'Data Analysis', 'Statistical Analysis', 'IBM SPSS', 'Neo4j', 'Search Engine Optimization', 'Python', 'Data Science']

title: Real Estate Analyst ‚Äì Land Valuation / Comping
description:
Senior Real Estate Analyst ‚Äì Land Valuation (Remote)

Only Apply If You Are the Best at What You Do.

We are looking for an elite land valuation specialist to take full ownership of our comping process. If you are someone who moves fast, thinks critically, and delivers precise, data-driven property valuations, this is your opportunity to join a high-performance real estate team.

This is not a beginner role.
This is not a task-based VA job.
This is an opportunity to be a key decision-maker in a fast-scaling land investment firm where your research directly impacts multi-million-dollar acquisitions.

If you‚Äôre looking for just another remote job, this isn‚Äôt it.
If you‚Äôre an absolute pro at land comping and want a role that rewards speed, accuracy, and ownership‚Äîkeep reading.

Who We Are & Why This Role Matters

Higher Ground Land Company is not your average real estate business. We specialize in buying and selling vacant land across the U.S. Our acquisitions team moves at an elite speed, executing high-value deals every week.

Your role?
To be the foundation of our buying process.

Without precise comps, we don‚Äôt make offers.
Without smart valuations, we don‚Äôt close deals.
Without you, we can‚Äôt scale.

This is a high-stakes role for someone who thrives under pressure and takes complete ownership of their work.

What Winning Looks Like in This Role

You master the art of land comping using Redfin, Zillow, Land.com, MLS, county GIS maps, and other data tools to determine exact property values‚Äîno guessing.
You deliver fast, accurate comps based on sold and active listings‚Äîhelping us make high-confidence investment decisions.
You analyze every detail that affects land value‚Äîroad access, flood zones, wetlands, topography, existing structures, and market trends.
You complete 10-15 property comps per day with precision, allowing our acquisitions team to move at full speed.
You present your findings clearly in Google Sheets, making complex data easy to digest.
You own your role. This isn‚Äôt about checking off tasks‚Äîit‚Äôs about driving real business results.

Who You Are

You have direct experience comping land. House comping experience is not enough‚Äîyou have worked in another land investment business and know how to evaluate vacant land.
You operate at an elite level. You can work fast and accurately under pressure‚Äîbecause you know every comp is a high-stakes decision.
You have a relentless attention to detail. You don‚Äôt just ‚Äúpull data‚Äù‚Äîyou analyze, verify, and refine comps to ensure accuracy.
You are tech-savvy. You‚Äôre comfortable with Google Sheets, mapping software, research tools, and high-volume data analysis.
You can explain your findings clearly. Your research makes or breaks a deal, and you know how to present data concisely.
You have the right setup. A fast computer and high-speed internet are non-negotiable‚Äîyou‚Äôll be working in a high-speed workflow where every second matters.

What We Offer

Competitive Pay: $5-7/hr (based on experience)
Flexible Hours: Full-Time or Part-Time (We want the right person, not just a warm body.)
Fully Remote: Work from anywhere in the world
Growth Potential: Top performers rise fast in our company. If you execute at a high level, there‚Äôs long-term opportunity here.

This Role is Not for Everyone.

If you need constant direction, this isn‚Äôt for you.
If you‚Äôre looking for an easy paycheck, look elsewhere.
If you thrive in high-performance environments and want to play a mission-critical role in a fast-growing company‚Äîapply now.

We don‚Äôt hire average.
We hire the best.

If that‚Äôs you, let‚Äôs talk.

title: CRE Capital Markets Analyst
description:
CRE Capital Markets Analyst

Job Title: Financial Analyst (Commercial Real Estate)
Reports to: Managing Partner
Employment Status: Part-Time with potential for Full-Time

About the Company:
We are partners in securing the financial backbone for commercial real estate ventures across the United States. We specialize in creating custom financing solutions, navigating through the complexities of debt placement and equity raising with a hands-on approach that has set us apart in the industry. Our extensive network of lenders and diverse loan program options ensures that our clients receive financing that is aligned with their unique loan requirements. From the initial application to the final handshake at closing, our team of mortgage specialists and in-house closing experts streamline the loan process, delivering exceptional service and value. We have secured over $250M in loans for our clients and are dedicated to accelerating the loan acquisition timeline, ensuring they secure favorable mortgage terms efficiently, saving them both time and money.

About the Job Opportunity:
This position is focused on the placement of debt and/or equity for CRE and commercial middle-market businesses. As a CRE Capital Markets Analyst, you will be at the forefront of applying innovative financial strategies and solutions for our diverse portfolio of clients and commercial properties. This role offers a unique opportunity to engage in comprehensive market analysis, financial modeling, and deal structuring to optimize investment returns and asset performance. You will work closely with loan originators to develop and implement customized capital market strategies that align with our client‚Äôs objectives and the evolving commercial real estate landscape. This position is ideal for a proactive, analytical thinker who thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative environment and is passionate about leveraging financial expertise to create value and drive growth.  Additionally, you will be responsible for identifying potential lenders and reaching out to them to establish and maintain strong financing relationships.

Key Responsibilities:
- Conduct comprehensive financial analysis and develop detailed financial models to support investment decisions, including cash flow projections, IRR calculations, and sensitivity analysis.
- Engage in all stages of transactions, from underwriting and market research to client meetings and closing events.
- Prepare debt and/or equity offering memorandums, leveraging strong financial modeling skills and market intelligence.
- Assist in structuring and negotiating financing terms for debt and equity transactions, ensuring optimal terms and conditions for clients.
- Drive the due diligence process, including financial audits and market analysis, to evaluate the feasibility and risk of investment opportunities.
- Apply technical proficiency in database use to extract valuable trends and data for pitch preparation and client meetings.
- Review and assess real estate documents to proactively identify and address potential issues that may affect positive outcomes of deals.
- Develop innovative financing alternatives and strategies and present these to senior producers.
- Establish and expand a client network through active industry engagement and participation in real estate organizations.
- Maintain strong relationships with clients, lenders, and other stakeholders, acting as a key point of contact and ensuring exceptional service delivery.
- Prepare detailed reports, and presentations for internal and external stakeholders, ensuring accuracy and clarity.
- Collaborate in weekly meetings to discuss deal flow, market conditions, and generate new client leads.

Desired Skills and Experience
- Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Finance, Real Estate, Economics, or related field.
- 2-5 years in commercial real estate and capital markets.
- Strong proficiency in financial analysis, modeling, and valuation techniques.
- Understanding of commercial real estate markets and trends.
- Proficiency in Excel
- Excellent analytical and quantitative abilities.
- Strong verbal and written communication skills.
- High level of accuracy and attention to detail.
- Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.

title: Motion Capture Data Extraction and Processing
description:
I am looking for an experienced data analyst with a strong background in biomechanics and motion capture data processing. The task involves extracting kinematic data from .CSV or .MAT files, computing Continuous Relative Phase (CRP) and Deviation Phase (DP), and delivering tables and visualizations of the results.

Scope of Work
1. Data Extraction:
Extract kinematic data for the following segments (labels will be provided):
Lx (Lumbar region)
Pelvis
Hip (Left and Right)
Knee (Left and Right)
Ankle (Left and Right)
Provide the extracted data in CSV or MATLAB format with clear labels.

2. CRP & DP Calculation
Compute Continuous Relative Phase (CRP) and Deviation Phase (DP) using formulas I provide.
Ensure correct phase angle calculations and data alignment.

3. Data Presentation
Deliver tables and charts for CRP and DP analysis.
Specify the format for tables and visualizations (e.g., Excel, Python plots, MATLAB figures).

Requirements
Experience with motion capture data processing.
Proficiency in MATLAB, Python (NumPy, SciPy, Pandas), or R.
Strong background in biomechanics and kinematic data analysis.
Familiarity with CSV and MAT file formats.
Ability to compute phase angles and apply vector coding techniques.

Deliverables
‚úÖ Extracted motion capture data (CSV/MAT format)
‚úÖ CRP & DP calculations (Excel or structured table format)
‚úÖ Visualizations (MATLAB figures, Python plots, or Excel charts)
‚úÖ Documentation on methodology used

title: Land Research & Analysis Specialist for Development Potential
description:

I‚Äôm looking for a detail-oriented researcher/analyst to help identify properties that are prime for future development. Property Identification

Identify parcels that are in‚Äîor near‚Äîareas designated for higher-density or mixed-use zoning changes.

Utility & Infrastructure Review

Check proximity to roads, water lines, and other infrastructure based on county/municipality data.

Location & Zoning Analysis

Assess property zoning and any publicly available information on planned rezoning or land use changes.

Data Compilation & Reporting

Parcel ID

title: GIS Specialist Needed for Renewable Energy Project
description:

‚Ä¢ Transmission substations
‚Ä¢ Transmission lines.
‚Ä¢ Land parcels.
‚Ä¢ Areas of suitable land near substations and transmission lines.

Initial Project Tasks
1. Identify Suitable Target Sites:

2. Research Utility Service Territories:

4. Additional Layers and Analysis:

title: Remote Deal Originator for M&A Sourcing
description:
Job Posting: Deal Originator (Remote, Full-Time) | Private Equity Firm | TEEDUP

Overview

TEEDUP is a private equity firm focused on strategic acquisitions. With a goal of closing four deals by the end of 2025, we need to keep our pipeline full and efficient. As a Deal Originator, you will be responsible for sourcing and managing deals at the top of the funnel, ensuring a steady stream of opportunities for our Senior Analysts.

This role is critical in ensuring that deals progress through the pipeline efficiently so that our Senior Analyst can focus on high-value tasks. If you are detail-oriented, highly organized, and enjoy researching and identifying acquisition opportunities, this is a great opportunity to work in the private equity space.

Role & Responsibilities

The Deal Originator will focus on sourcing and qualifying deals based on TEEDUP‚Äôs acquisition criteria. Key responsibilities include:
‚Ä¢ Deal Sourcing & Management
‚Ä¢ Identify and source potential acquisition opportunities from brokers, deal scouts, online marketplaces, and direct outreach.
‚Ä¢ Register and track new deals in TEEDUP‚Äôs CRM (GoHighLevel).
‚Ä¢ Ensure each deal meets TEEDUP‚Äôs minimum deal criteria before passing it to the Senior Analyst.
‚Ä¢ Work within the Pacific Standard Time (PST) schedule to coordinate with brokers and analysts.
‚Ä¢ Pipeline Management & Qualification
‚Ä¢ Enter 43 new deals per week into the pipeline.
‚Ä¢ Move 22 deals per week to the Pre-Qualification stage.
‚Ä¢ Progress 4 deals per week to the Discovery stage.
‚Ä¢ Sign and manage NDAs (MNDAs), ensuring confidentiality agreements are in place.
‚Ä¢ Attach and organize Confidential Information Memorandums (CIMs) to the CRM.
‚Ä¢ Create deal folders in SharePoint and organize relevant documents.
‚Ä¢ Conduct an initial CIM review to assess viability.
‚Ä¢ Identify and filter out non-starters (e.g., deals outside the U.S., EBITDA below $1MM).
‚Ä¢ Broker & Platform Outreach
‚Ä¢ Engage with brokers via email to request CIMs and deal details.
‚Ä¢ Search deal marketplaces (BizBuySell, BusinessBroker.net, BizQuest, DealStream, Transworld, Sunbelt, etc.).
‚Ä¢ Use standard messaging templates to request deal information.
‚Ä¢ Maintain organized communication logs with brokers and sellers.

Qualifications & Skills

To be successful in this role, you should have:
‚úî Strong research and data entry skills ‚Äì ability to accurately track and log deal information.
‚úî Experience with CRMs (preferably GoHighLevel) or similar deal-tracking software.
‚úî Attention to detail ‚Äì ability to assess basic financials and key deal criteria.
‚úî Ability to work independently ‚Äì must be proactive in sourcing and tracking new deals.
‚úî Strong written communication skills ‚Äì professional email outreach and follow-ups.
‚úî Basic understanding of financials ‚Äì familiarity with EBITDA, revenue, and acquisition metrics.
‚úî Previous experience in deal origination, private equity, investment banking, or M&A is a plus.

Compensation & Work Schedule

üí∞ Hourly Rate: $5 - $10 per hour (Based on experience)
‚è≥ Hours: Full-time (40 hours per week)
üåç Location: Remote (Must be available during Pacific Standard Time (PST))
üìà Growth Opportunity: Potential to move into higher roles within TEEDUP as experience grows.

Why Join TEEDUP?
‚Ä¢ Gain experience in private equity and deal origination.
‚Ä¢ Work with an experienced acquisition team.
‚Ä¢ Flexible remote work environment.
‚Ä¢ Training and resources provided (CRM access, deal criteria, platform walkthroughs).
‚Ä¢ Opportunity for long-term work based on performance.

Onboarding Process

You‚Äôll receive:
‚úÖ TEEDUP email & CRM access (GoHighLevel)
‚úÖ Training on deal sourcing platforms (BizBuySell, BusinessBroker.net, etc.)
‚úÖ Introduction to broker email lists & newsletters
‚úÖ Access to SharePoint & deal-tracking systems
‚úÖ Walkthrough of deal origination processes & messaging templates

Application Process

Interested candidates should apply with:
üìÑ Resume highlighting relevant experience
üìß A brief cover letter or message explaining why you‚Äôre a good fit
üîç Any past experience with CRM systems, deal sourcing, or financial analysis

Join TEEDUP and help us close four deals by the end of 2025!

title: Senior Technical Business Analyst ‚Äì Healthcare & FHIR Integration
description:
Location: REMOTE - 6 month contract
Working hours: Mon through Fri, 8hours/day, 40 hours/week, US Business hours (Central time zone)
***YOU MUST UPLOAD YOUR RESUME IN MICROSOFT WORD***


JOB DESCRIPTION
Our client is seeking a Senior Technical Business Analyst with extensive experience in FHIR (Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources) implementation and troubleshooting, to support healthcare data exchange across multiple systems and clients. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of Healthcare interoperability, HL7 FHIR standards, API integrations, and regulatory compliance (HIPAA, ONC, CMS Interoperability Rules).  

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
- Lead FHIR-based integration projects, ensuring seamless data exchange between EHRs, HIEs, payers, and third-party systems.  
- Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements, map workflows, and define FHIR API specifications.  
- Troubleshoot and optimize FHIR data exchange, ensuring complixance with US Core, SMART on FHIR, and industry standards.  
- Perform FHIR conformance testing, validating API responses using Postman, HAPI FHIR, and Touchstone  
- Ensure compliance with HIPAA, ONC Cures Act, and CMS interoperability mandates for healthcare data access.  
- Document business and technical requirements, user stories, and integration workflows for multiple clients.  
- Support FHIR transformation and migration initiatives, mapping legacy data (HL7 v2, CCDAs, SQL) to FHIR resources.  

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
- 5+ years of experience as a Technical Business Analyst in healthcare IT.  
- Expertise in FHIR standards (R4, US Core, SMART on FHIR) and healthcare interoperability.  
- Strong understanding of RESTful APIs, OAuth 2.0, and FHIR-based authentication mechanisms.  
- Technical background in SQL, JSON, XML, and healthcare data standards
- Experience with EHR systems (Epic, Cerner, Meditech), HIEs, and payer-provider integrations.  
- Proficiency in data mapping, HL7 v2 to FHIR transformations, and FHIR profiling.  
- Hands-on experience with FHIR tools (Postman, HAPI FHIR, Redox, Azure API for FHIR, Mirth Connect).  
- Strong analytical, problem-solving, and stakeholder management skills.  
- Knowledge of healthcare regulations (HIPAA, ONC, CMS).
- Strong communication skills (written and verbal)

PREFERRED -
- Familiarity with FHIR validation and conformance testing tools.

***YOU MUST UPLOAD YOUR RESUME IN MICROSOFT WORD, OTHERWISE YOU WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED***
